<script>
function csrfToken() {
  var element = document.getElementById('token-login');
  var csrf_token = $('meta[name="csrf-token"]').attr('content');
  element.setAttribute('value', csrf_token);
  };
</script>

<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
    // Define the start date and calculate the end date
    var startDate = new Date('2024-05-07'); // Hard-coded start date
    var endDate = new Date(startDate);
    endDate.setDate(startDate.getDate() + 7); // 7 days after the start date

    var currentDate = new Date(); // Get today's date

    // Check if the current date is within the valid date range
    if (currentDate >= startDate && currentDate <= endDate) {
        // If within range, slide down the announcement
        $("#anncmnt").slideDown("slow");
    }

    // Close button functionality
    document.getElementById('anncClose').onclick = function(){
        $("#anncmnt").slideUp(); // Using slideUp for consistent animation on close
    };
});
</script>

        <div id="page-content-wrapper">
    
    		<div class="block">   
	<h2 id="intro" class="page-header">ATTOM API: Immediate access to the property data you need</h2> 
    <h3 id="introOverview" class="page-subtopics">Steps for Getting Started</h3>  
    <ol>
    	<li><p><strong><!--<a href="" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#signup" id="signup_now">-->  <a href="/signup"> Create your free trial account</a></strong> on the Attom Developer Platform to get an API key to use when calling the API.</p></li>
        <li><p>Explore the details of our APIs to get a better idea of the data available in each and the calls you would use to collect the data.</p></li>
        <li><p>Use our interactive docs to make sample API calls and use our guides to get started with Curl or Postman.</p></li>
        <!--<li><p>Speed up your development with our content templates to plug into your application.<a href="/sample-code-guide" target="_blank"> <strong> View them here.</strong></a></p></li> -->
	</ol>

     <p><a href="/docs/guides#curl" target="_blank" class="boldLink">Getting Started with cURL</a> - This guide covers the basics like displaying properties within a particular city, looking at a property’s valuation and displaying recent sale prices within a given neighborhood.</p>
     <p><a href="/docs/guides#postman" target="_blank" class="boldLink">Postman Guide</a> - Postman is a Web REST client that allows you to enter and monitor HTTP requests and responses. It is available in the Chrome Web Store and is a great way to get familiar with our APIs and the data returned by different calls.</p>

		<p>Building a full application means getting to know the various resources and packages in the API. The following are the most important concepts that we go into more detail about below in the documentation.</p>
        <p>
        <ol>
            <li>URL Structure</li>
            <li>Headers</li>
            <li>Resources & Packages</li>       
            <li>Default Behavior</li>       
            <li>Search & Sorting
            <ol type="a">
               <li>Some example requests</li>	
            </ol>  
        </p>
  
   
  		<p><strong>Watch our API training video here:</strong></p>
  		<iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/a2Y1oO52ep0"></iframe>
  
 
        <h3 id="introSecurity" class="page-subtopics">Security</h3>                
        <p>All requests to all endpoints require you to specify your unique API key. The API Key is assigned to you by Attom and is used to identify and authorize each request. Your API key should be kept private, and should never be displayed publicly.</p>
        <h3 id="introResponseCodes" class="page-subtopics">Response Codes</h3>                
        <p>All successful responses are returned in JSON or XML, depending on the response format you request. Only queries that respond with a 200 response code (successfully completed), are counted towards monthly allowances and overages. Beyond standard HTTP codes you will find custom status codes in the “Status” element of the response body.</p>     
         <br/>
         <p>
            <div class="row" id="tblResponseCodes">
              <div class="col-xs-12">
                    <div class="row">
                        <div class="col-xs-4" id="responseCodesHeader-Inner-Left">Status Code</div>  
                        <div class="col-xs-8" id="responseCodesHeader-Inner-Side">Description</div>                       
						<div class="col-xs-4" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Left">200 OK</div>  
                        <div class="col-xs-8" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Side">Standard HTTP successful response</div>
						<div class="col-xs-4" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Left">400 Bad Request</div>  
                        <div class="col-xs-8" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Side">Standard HTTP invalid request response</div>
						<div class="col-xs-4" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Left">401 Unauthorized</div>  
                        <div class="col-xs-8" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Side">Standard HTTP unauthorized access response</div>
						<div class="col-xs-4" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Left">500 Internal Server Error<br/>&nbsp;</div>  
                        <div class="col-xs-8" id="responseCodesContent-Inner-Side">There was an unexpected error on our server. If you see this please contact <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></div>                      
                    </div>  
                 </div>  
              </div>  
           </p>
          </div> <!-- end block -->          
     
            <hr>
            
            <div class="block">
              	<h2 id="prop">Property API</h2>
              <h3 id="propOverview" class="page-subtopics">Overview</h3>  
              <p>The Property API provides access to a comprehensive portfolio of property-centric data, empowering users with information on over 150 million properties across the United States. This API aggregates information from multiple sources, enabling a full view of property characteristics, ownership, transactions, and valuation metrics.</p>
              <p>It includes data on key aspects such as property addresses, building permits, current ownership details, and property characteristics, alongside critical transaction records like deeds, mortgages, and sales trends. In addition, users can access neighborhood-specific details, such as school district and individual school profiles. Valuation data, including assessed values, automated valuation models (AVM), and home equity estimates, further enhance the breadth of information available through the Property API.</p>
              <p>This robust dataset is designed to support developers, real estate professionals, and financial analysts in making well-informed decisions based on reliable and detailed property information.</p>
              <h3 id="propInteractiveDocs" class="page-subtopics">Interactive Docs</h3> 
              </br>
              <div class="page-important-box">
                NOTE: All our resource and their endpoints (packages) have been listed below with some common query parameters. However, these endpoints can also be queried through several other parameters. Please refer to the <a href="#PropertySearchFilter" onclick="ifChrome('PropertySearchFilter');" > <strong> Search Filters </strong> </a> section for full list of query parameters that can be applied to these endpoints.
              </div> 
              
               <script src="https://d1nbctyd1bqfhd.cloudfront.net/dev-portal-assets/swagger-ui/2.2.10/swagger-ui.js"></script> 
			   <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://d1nbctyd1bqfhd.cloudfront.net/dev-portal-assets/swagger-ui/2.2.10/swagger-ui.css" />

			 <br /><br /><br />
              <h3 id="propAPIStructure" class="page-subtopics">API Structure</h3>                
              
			                                
              	  			  <h4>Production Endpoint</h4>
			  <p>The main endpoint for the property search engine API is:
                 <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/Resource/Package?{parameters}</code></pre></p>
			  <p>Example
                 <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/property/detail?id=1234</code></pre></p>
			  <h4>Headers</h4>
              <p>There are two required headers:</p>     
              <p>
                 <ol>
                   <li>Accept - set to either
                        <ol type="a">
                          <li>application/json</li>	
                          <li>application/xml</li>
                        </ol>  
                   </li>
                   <li>APIKey - include the API Key assigned to you.</li>                   
                 </ol>
              </p> 
			  <h4>Resources & Packages</h4>
			  <p>Our data is organized into a set of resources. While all resources ultimately relate to a property (or piece of real estate) they contain different topics. We have also created “Packages” that summarize specific fields for ease of use. The packages available depend on the type of data (resource) being searched. You’ll find the available <strong>Resources</strong> and <strong>Packages</strong> below. </p>
			  <h4>Resources</h4>
			  <h5>PROPERTY</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/property</strong> resource to get detailed property characteristics for a property or list of properties.</p>  
              <div class="page-important-box">
                <strong>What kinds of questions can data from the /property resource help answer?</strong>
                <br/><br/>
                <ul>
                  <li>What properties fall within a radius of a given point (lat/long)?</li>
                  <li>Are there properties within a zip code with property taxes of a given range?</li>
                  <li>Can I validate the authenticity of the owner listed for a property?</li>
                  <li>What data is available about a new property owner? </li>
                  <li>What properties in a given area have the most current equity or are close to the end of their loan?</li>
                </ul>
                <br/><br/>
                Check out the Interactive Docs to test out more of the capabilities of the <strong>property</strong> resource.
              </div>
              <br/>  

  			  <h5>SALES TREND</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/salestrend</strong> resource to get two years of average or median sale price and sale counts within a zip code for monthly, quarterly, and yearly intervals.</p>  
              <div class="page-important-box">
                <strong>What kinds of questions can data from the /salestrend resource help answer?</strong>
                <br/><br/>
                <ul>
                  <li>How do recent sales within a zip code compare to my houses valuation?</li>
                  <li>Are the home sales increasing in amount and count in my area?</li>
              </div>
              <br/>

  			  <h5>SCHOOL</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/school</strong> resource to get schools within attendance zones around a property, private and public schools within a radius and school details. Note that some schools are not associated with a school district because of a variety of rules in different state. View the list <a href="https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B9H5b1ckQ8HQMDQ3cy1MbWpkVnc" target="_blank"><strong>here.</strong></a></p>  
              <div class="page-important-box">
                <strong>What kinds of questions can data from the /school resource help answer?</strong>
                <br/><br/>
                <ul>
                  <li>Which schools could my kids attend if I live at a certain property?</li>
                  <li>What private schools are within a 10 mile radius of a given property?</li>
                  <li>What is the test rating, enrollment rates, and special programs offered at a specific school?</li>			
              </div>

			  <h5>ASSESSMENT</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/assessment</strong> resource to get assessments, assessed values and taxes on a property or list of properties.</p>  
              <div class="page-important-box">
                <strong>What kinds of questions can data from the /assessment resource help answer?</strong>
                <br/><br/>
                <ul>
                  <li>What are the assessment details of properties within a specific area?</li>
                  <li>What is the last known tax amount and assessment for a specific property?</li>
                  <li>What assessments were added within a given date range?</li>			
              </div>

			  <h5>AVM</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/attomavm</strong> resource to display the “automated valuation model” (AVM) calculation of a property or list of properties. </p>  
              <div class="page-important-box">
                <strong>Can AVM values be calculated without having property characteristics like, square footage, beds, baths?</strong>
                <br/><br/>
		        Yes. Although it's important to note how an AVM's confidence score can be affected. Below are a couple different scenarios:<br/><br/>
                Property details come from the public county records and coverage varies county to county. Some counties simply don't provide this level of detail and all properties used to calculate the valuation would effectively be in the same ‘boat’. In this situation you would expect confidence scores to be a bit higher.<br/><br/>
                However, if the missing attributes are isolated to a single property and other comparable properties used in the valuation have this data, this may negatively affect the confidence score. <br/><br/>
                <strong>* The “scr” attribute represents the confidence in the calculation.</strong>				
              </div>

			  <h5>SALE</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/sale</strong> resource to return information pertaining to the most recent sale of a property or list of properties.</p>  
              <div class="page-important-box">
                <strong>What kinds of questions can data from the /sale resource help answer?</strong>
                <br/><br/>
                <ul>
                  <li>What is the last sale price of all the properties within this specific area?</li>
                  <li>What properties  have sold over the last three months within this price range in this ZIP code?</li>
                  <li>What is the the last sale on this specific property?</li>			
              </div>

			  <h5>SALES HISTORY</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/saleshistory</strong> resource to get information about the sales history of a property. Recorded sales history data can be found based on a property’s ID or address.</p>  
	      <br/>
                <p>Note: This is accessible for a single property <strong>per request</strong>.</p>	
              <br/>
              <div class="page-important-box">
                ATTOM provides 10 years of sales history data.
              </div>
			  <h5>ALL EVENTS</h5> 
<p>Use the <strong>/allevents</strong> resource to get information about all events that have occurred on a specific property. This includes assessments, AVM and sales transactions. Note: This is accessible for a single property <strong>per request</strong>. </p>  
	      <br/>
                
			  <h4>Packages</h4> 
              <p>The table below shows what packages are available for each resource with a brief descriptions.</p>
              <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                         <table class="table table-hover">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th>Package</th>
                                                    <th>Description</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>/ID</td>
                                                    <td>A set of IDs associated with a record or list of records</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>/Address</td>
                                                    <td>Address and location information of a record or list of records</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>/Snapshot</td>
                                                    <td>Summary information typically used for limited display, data points include: address info, property type, beds/baths and property type.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>/Detail</td>
                                                    <td>Rich property data including lot size, property type, year built, bath/beds, construction type, utilities etc.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                  	<td>/DetailMortgage</td>
                                                  	<td>Only available for the /Property resource. Detailed property data with mortgage information included.</td>
                                              	</tr>
                                              	<tr>
                                                  	<td>/DetailOwner</td>
                                                  	<td>Only available for the /Property resource. Detailed property data with owner information included.</td>
                                              	</tr>
                                              	<tr>
                                                  	<td>/DetailMortgageOwner</td>
                                                  	<td>Only available for the /Property resource. Detailed property data with mortgage and owner information included.</td>
                                              	</tr>                                            												 <tr>
                                                  	<td>/Detailwithschools</td>
                                                  	<td>Only available for the /School resource. Detailed property data and schools within the attendance zone of the property.</td>
                                              	</tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
			  </p>                  

              <h4>Default Behavior</h4>
              <p>There is some default behavior to be aware of:</p>   
              <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th>Setting</th>
                                                    <th>Value</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Maximum number of records in a single response</td>
                                                    <td>100</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Default radius if not supplied</td>
                                                    <td>5 miles</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Maximum radius allowed</td>
                                                    <td>20 miles</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Maximum sort values</td>
                                                    <td>1</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Maximum number of GeoIDs in a single request</td>
                                                    <td>3</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Default sort, radius search</td>
                                                    <td>Distance Asc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Default sort, non-radius searches</td>
                                                    <td>CalendarDate Desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
                 </p>

									<div id="PropertySearchFilter"> </div>
                                    <h4 id="filter">Search Filters</h4> 
                                    <p>In addition to Resources and Packages, there are also a number of other filters that may be added to a request to help narrow down results. The filters and some examples of how they might be used are outlined below.</p>
                					<p>If you are looking to add multiple filters to your query, you can add pipe delineation ("|") to your API call. For example, if you wanted to search for single family resident and apartment property types, you could add "&propertytype=sfr|apartment" to your query to return results for both types.</p> 
                                    <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover dataTable">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Path</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Type</th>
                                                  <th>Description</th>
                                                  <th>Example</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Possible values</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>GeoIDV4</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Geocode</td><td>geoIdV4=baa5d7de09afdefd0ffcd66b581991de</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>Interval</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Interval to search</td><td>interval=yearly</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>StartYear</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Start year in the interval</td><td>2018</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>EndYear</td><td>Single Value</td><td>End year in the interval</td><td>2023</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>StartQuarter</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Start quarter in the interval (quarterly)</td><td>1</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>EndQuarter</td><td>Single Value</td><td>End quarter in the interval (quarterly)</td><td>3</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>StartMonth</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Start month in the interval (monthly)</td><td>1</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>EndMonth</td><td>Single Value</td><td>End month in the interval (monthly)</td><td>3</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>PropertyType</td><td>Multiple Values</td><td>Property Type to filter results</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Transaction Sales Trend</td><td>/transaction/salestrend</td><td>TransferType</td><td>Multiple Values</td><td>Transfer Type to filter results</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

<tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>ATTOMID</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Attom-assigned ID</td><td>attomId=184196315</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>ID</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Attom-assigned property ID</td><td>ID=184196315</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>FIPS & APN</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Fips code for a property and Assessor's parcel number.</td><td>fips=08031&APN=0914501010000</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>ADDRESS</td><td>Single Value</td><td>The property address</td><td>address=468%20SEQUOIA%20DR,SMYRNA,%20DE%2019977</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>ADDRESS1 & ADDRESS2</td><td>Single Value</td><td>The first and last line of the property address</td><td>address1=468%20SEQUOIA%20DR&address2=SMYRNA,%20DE%2019977</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>RADIUS</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Circular radius distance in miles Note: May be used in conjunction with Latitude / Longitude or Address input</td><td>radius=10</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>LONGITUDE & LATITUDE </td><td>Single Value</td><td>Latitude and Longitude pair Note: MUST include a radius</td><td>latitude=39.21523130910493&longitude=-75.62095642089844</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>POSTALCODE</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Postal ZIP Code</td><td>postalCode=19977</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr> 
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>CALENDARDATE</td><td>Range</td><td>The date the record was last updated</td><td>startCalendarDate=2018/01/04&endCalendarDate=2019/05/01</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>ADDEDDATE</td><td>Range</td><td>The date the record was added to the system</td><td>startAddedDate=2018/01/04&endAddedDate=2019/05/01</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>PROPERTYTYPE</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Standardized property type</td><td>propertyType=apartment</td><td><a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/679-propertytype" style="color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;" target="_blank">Click here</a></td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>PROPERTYINDICATOR</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Standardized property type indicator</td><td>propertyIndicator=22</td><td>0 Miscellaneous<br/>10 Single Family Residence / Townhouse<br/>11 Condominium (residential)<br/>20 Commercial<br/>21 Duplex, Triplex, Quadplex<br/>22 Apartment<br/>23 Hotel, Motel<br/>24 Commercial (condominium)<br/>25 Retail<br/>26 Service (general public)<br/>27 Office Building<br/>29 Financial Institution<br/>30 Hospital (medical complex, clinic)<br/>31 Parking<br/>32 Amusement-Recreation<br/>50 Industrial<br/>51 Industrial Light<br/>52 Industrial Heavy<br/>53 Transport<br/>54 Utilities<br/>70 Agricultural<br/>80 Vacant<br/>90 Exempt</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>UNIVERSALSIZE</td><td>Range</td><td>The property size (in square feet) that best reflects the most common measurement within a county</td><td>minUniversalSize=1200&maxUniversalSize=1800</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>YEARBUILT</td><td>Range</td><td>Year the property was buillt</td><td>minYearBuilt=2008&maxYearBuilt=2018</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>LOTSIZE1</td><td>Range</td><td>Lot size in acres</td><td>minLotSize1=.5&maxLotSize1=1.5</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Property ID</td><td>/property/id</td><td>LOTSIZE2</td><td>Range</td><td>Lot size in square feet</td><td>minLotSize2=12000&maxLotSize2=20000</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

<tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>BATHSTOTAL</td><td>Range</td><td>The number of bathrooms</td><td>minBathsTotal=1&maxBathsTotal=3</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>GEOID</td><td>Multi-Value</td><td>ATTOM geographic identifier. These may be found in ATTOM boundary and other products. </td><td>geoID=CO12127|CO12145</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>GEOIDV4</td><td>Multi-Value</td><td>ATTOM’s new geographic identifier. These may be found through /location/lookup endpoint.</td><td>geoIDV4=712b44e372bc317839c7203b976bf0ee</td><td>The Property API currently returns the following geographies: ST = State, CO = County, ZI = Zip Code Tabulation Area, SB = School Attendance Area, DB = School District Boundary, PL = Census Place, CS = County Subdivision, N1 = Macro Neighborhood, N2 = Neighborhood, N3 = Sub-Neighborhood, N4 = Residential Subdivision</td></tr>
<tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>AVMVALUE</td><td>Range</td><td>Automated Valuation Model Value </td><td>minAVMValue=150000&maxAVMValue=250000</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>SALESEARCHDATE</td><td>Range</td><td>Sale date for search purposes</td><td>startSaleSearchDate=2018/01/01&endSaleSearchDate=2019/12/31</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>SALEAMT</td><td>Range</td><td>Amount of the last sale on the property</td><td>minSaleAmt=200000&maxSaleAmt=350000</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 
<tr><td>All Events Snapshot</td><td>/allevents/snapshot</td><td>ATTOMID</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Attom-assigned ID</td><td>attomId=184196315</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Snapshot</td><td>/allevents/snapshot</td><td>ID</td><td>Single Value</td><td>Attom-assigned property ID</td><td>ID=184196315</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

 <tr><td>All Events Snapshot</td><td>/allevents/snapshot</td><td>ADDRESS</td><td>Single Value</td><td>The property address</td><td>address=468%20SEQUOIA%20DR,SMYRNA,%20DE%2019977</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Snapshot</td><td>/allevents/snapshot</td><td>ADDRESS1 & ADDRESS2</td><td>Single Value</td><td> The first and last line of the property address</td><td>address1=468%20SEQUOIA%20DR&address2=SMYRNA,%20DE%2019977</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

                </p> 
								<h4>Search Filter Examples</h4>
                                <p>Show me all of the properties that have an assessed total value within this range that are within this ZIP Code.<pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/assessment/detail?postalcode=11215&minAssdTtlValue=1000000&maxAssdTtlValue=2500000</code></pre></p>
<br/>
<p>Show me all of the properties that have sold during a specified time frame  within this neighborhood.<pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/sale/snapshot?startSaleSearchDate=2015/05/01&endSaleSearchDate=2015/08/31&geoIdV4=6828b00047035292dd47fe020e636bb3</code></pre></p>
<br/>
<p>Show me all the properties that fall within a radius of this point.
<pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/property/snapshot?latitude=30.2500&longitude=-97.7500&radius=2
</code></pre></p><br/>
              <div class="page-important-box">
                <strong>Trying out these examples in Postman? Don’t forget, you’ll need to include your API Key in the header for these examples to work. </strong>
              </div>

                                        <h4>Order By (Sorting Results)</h4>
                                        Guess what? API Results can be sorted by in either ascending or descending order by several select fields. You’ll see the list of sortable fields and examples of how they might be used below. Don’t forget, you can play around with sortable fields in our <strong>Interactive Docs</strong>! 

                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th>Name</th>
                                                    <th>Description</th>
                                                    <th>Example</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Distance</td>
                                                    <td>Distance in miles from the start point. This field only works with Latitude / Longitude or Address with a radius as input</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=distance asc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                 <tr>
                                                    <td>CalendarDate</td>
                                                    <td>The date the record was last updated</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=calendarDate asc</td>
                                                </tr>
												<tr>
                                                    <td>PublishedDate</td>
                                                    <td>The date the record was added</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=publisheddate asc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                 <tr>
                                                    <td>PropertyType</td>
                                                    <td>Standardized property type</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=propertyType desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                 <tr>
                                                    <td>SaleAmt</td>
                                                    <td>Amount of the last sale on the property</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=saleAmt desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                 <tr>
                                                    <td>AvmValue</td>
                                                    <td>Automated Valuation Model Value</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=avmValue desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                 <tr>
                                                    <td>AssdTtlValue</td>
                                                    <td>Assessed total value</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=AssdTtlValue desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>SaleSearchDate</td>
                                                    <td>Last sale date</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=SaleSearchDate asc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>SaleTransactionDate</td>
                                                    <td>Date the sale transaction occurred</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=SaleTransactionDate asc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Beds</td>
                                                    <td>Total beds count</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=beds desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>BathsTotal</td>
                                                    <td>Total bathrooms count</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=bathsTotal asc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>UniversalSize</td>
                                                    <td>The property size (in square feet) that best reflects the most common measurement within a county</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=universalSize asc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>LotSize1</td>
                                                    <td>Lot size in acres</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=lotSize1 desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>LotSize2</td>
                                                    <td>Lot size in square feet</td>
                                                    <td>orderBy=lotSize2 desc</td>
                                                </tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
<h4>Sort Examples</h4>
                                <p>Show me all of the properties that have sold within the radius of a specific point and are sorted in descending order by their sale amount.<pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/sale/snapshot?latitude=30.2500&longitude=-97.7500&radius=2&orderBy=saleAmt+desc</code></pre></p>
<br/><br/>
<p>Show me all of the single family residences within this zip code ordered by their number of bedrooms in descending order. <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/property/detail?postalcode=78704&propertytype=sfr&orderBy=beds+desc</code></pre></p>
<br/><br/>
<p>Show me all the assessments made on properties within the radius of a specific point ordered by their distance from the point. <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/assessment/snapshot?latitude=39.731234&longitude=-75.581182&radius=1&orderby=distance+ASC
</code></pre></p> <br/>
                                        <h4>Pagination</h4>
                                        You may request a specific page and number of results per page. By default the API will return page one and ten results per page. To modify the default behavior you may use the following arguments:
                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th>Argument</th>
                                                    <th>Value</th>
                                                    <th>Example</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Page</td>
                                                    <td>Integer</td>
                                                    <td>page=2</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>PageSize</td>
                                                    <td>Integer</td>
                                                    <td>pageSize=20</td>
                                                </tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>  

<h4>Standard Response Information</h4>
<p>A standard response from the property API will include the following structure to help you handle different response codes, page sizes, and number of records. This can be found at the top of the response:</p>
<p>{</p>
<p> "status": {</p> 
<p>	"version": "1.0.0",</p>
<p>	"code": 0,</p>
<p>	"msg": "SuccessWithResult",</p>
<p> "total": 1,</p>
<p>	"page": 1,</p>
<p>	"pagesize": 10</p>
<p> },</p>
		      	   

              <h3 id="propStatusCodes" class="page-subtopics">Status Codes</h3>                
              	  
				                            
              	  <p>The following table highlights the expected status codes from the system. Beyond standard HTTP codes you will find custom status codes in the “Status” element of the response body.</p>   
              <p>
                <div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover dataTable">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th>Status</th>
                                                    <th>Description</th>
                                                    <th></th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
											<tr>
                                                    <td>-8</td>
                                                    <td>Either GeoID or GeoIDV4 Value Required</td>
                                                    <td>Pass either GeoIDV4 or GeoID, but not both.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                               <tr>
                                                    <td>-6</td>
                                                    <td>Missing Parameter in Request</td>
                                                    <td>Location-based inputs were either missing or incomplete</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>-5</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Parameter in Request</td>
                                                    <td>You passed an invalid search parameter</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>-4</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Parameter Combination</td>
                                                    <td>You passed an invalid combination of parameters</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>0</td>
                                                    <td>SuccessWithResult</td>
                                                    <td>Your request was successful and returned results</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>400</td>
                                                    <td>SuccessWithoutResult</td>
                                                    <td>Your request was successful but returned no results</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>10</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Date Format</td>
                                                    <td>You did not pass the date value as YYYY/MM/DD</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>11</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Date Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your date range contains an error such as conflicting start and end dates</td>
                                                </tr><tr>
                                                    <td>12</td>
                                                    <td>Sort Value Exceeded</td>
                                                    <td>You passed more than the allowed number of sort values. See Default Behavior.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>13</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Sort Value</td>
                                                    <td>You passed a value that cannot be used for sort. See Sort Values.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>15</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid AVM Value Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your AVM Value range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>16</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Sale Amount Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Sale Amount range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>17</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Tax Amount Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Tax Amount range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>18</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Appr Impr Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Appraised Improvement range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>19</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Appr Land Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Appraised Land range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>20</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Appr Ttl Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Appraised Total range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>21</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Assd Impr Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Assessed Improvement range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>22</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Assd Land Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Assessed Land range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>23</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Assd Ttl Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Assessed Total range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>24</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Mkt Impr Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Market Improvement range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>25</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Mkt Land Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Market Land range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>26</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Mkt Ttl Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Market Total range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>27</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Universal Size Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Universal Size range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>28</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Year Built Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Year Built range contains an error such as a start date later than your end date.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>29</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Lot Size 1 Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Lot Size 1 range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>30</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Lot Size 2 Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Lot Size 2 range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>31</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Beds Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Beds range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr><tr>
                                                    <td>32</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid Baths Range</td>
                                                    <td>Your Baths range contains an error such as a higher minimum value than maximum value.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>33</td>
                                                    <td>GeoID Value Exceeded</td>
                                                    <td>You included more GeoIDs than are allowed in a single search. See Default Behavior.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>34</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid GeoID Value</td>
                                                    <td>You provided an invalid GeoID and should check that the data is correct.</td>
                                                </tr>
												<tr>
                                                    <td>36</td>
                                                    <td>FIPS and APN Value Required</td>
                                                    <td>You should provide both valid FIPS and APN..</td>
                                                </tr>
												<tr>
                                                    <td>37</td>
                                                    <td>Address1 and Address2 Value Required</td>
                                                    <td>You should provide both Address1 and Address2.</td>
                                                </tr>
												<tr>
                                                    <td>38</td>
                                                    <td>Number of GeoIDV4 values exceeded the maximum of 3.</td>
                                                    <td>You should provide an valid GeoIDV4 and the GeoIDV4 length should not exceed the maximum of 3.</td>
                                                </tr>
												<tr>
                                                    <td>39</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid GeoIdV4 Value</td>
                                                    <td>You provided an invalid GeoIdV4 and should check that the data is correct.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>401</td>
                                                    <td>Unauthorized</td>
                                                    <td>You are not authorized to access the resource</td>
                                                </tr>
                                              	
                                              	
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
                            <div class="page-important-box">
                              <strong>Need help with address formatting?</strong>
                              <br/><br/>
                              Check out this example request
                              <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/sale/detail?address1=586+FRANKLIN+AVE&address2=brooklyn+NY+11238</code></pre><br/>
                              <br/>
                              A space character in the query string may be encoded as either “%20” or “+”. You can use either, most people opt for “+” as it’s more human readable and fewer bytes.
              </div>
              </p>
		      	   

              <div id="PropertyDataDictionary"> </div>
			  <h3 id="propDataDictionary" class="page-subtopics">Data Dictionary</h3>                					
				                          
              	  <p>This data dictionary represents all of the fields currently available in the Property Search Engine API. Different resource and package combinations off access to specific fields within this dictionary and not all fields are available in each package. <p><div class="table-responsive">
      <table class="table table-striped dataTable">
            <thead>
               <tr>
                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Name</th>
                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Path</th>
                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Field Name</th>
                  <th>Description</th>
                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">JSON Path</th>
                </tr>
              </thead>
              <tbody>
                <!--All Events  Detail-->  
<tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>Id</td><td>ATTOM's legacy property property identifier (will be deprecated)</td><td>property.identifier.Id</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>fips</td><td>5 digit numeric Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code combining state and county codes where the property is located</td><td>property.identifier.fips</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>apn</td><td>Primary Parcel Number and unique identifier within the county/jurisdiction</td><td>property.identifier.apn</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>apnOrig</td><td>This is populated if a property has previously been split or came from another property ID</td><td>property.identifier.apnOrig</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>attomId</td><td> ATTOM Data's Unique parcel identifier.</td><td>property.identifier.attomId</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>depth</td><td>Indicates the lot depth, in feet</td><td>property.lot.depth</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>frontage</td><td>Indicates the lot width, in feet</td><td>property.lot.frontage</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>lotnum</td><td>Lot number</td><td>property.lot.lotNum</td></tr>
 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>lotsize1</td><td>Indicates the lot size, in acres</td><td>property.lot.lotSize1</td></tr>

 <tr><td>All Events Detail</td><td>/allevents/detail</td><td>lottype</td><td>Lot type</td><td>property.lot.lottype</td></tr>

<tr><td>Property Building Permits</td><td>/property/buildingpermits</td><td>jobValue</td><td>The job value estimate provided by the contractor on the permit. This value is provided prior to the start of work.</td><td>property.buildingPermits.jobValue</td></tr>
<tr><td>Property Building Permits</td><td>/property/buildingpermits</td><td>fees</td><td>The building permit fees paid to the presiding building permit authority. In absence of a declared job value, the fees are a reasonable, directional estimate to the size and scale of a project.</td><td>property.buildingPermits.fees</td></tr>
<tr><td>Property Building Permits</td><td>/property/buildingpermits</td><td>businessName</td><td>The name of the construction company that submitted the building permit.</td><td>property.buildingPermits.businessName</td></tr>
<tr><td>Property Building Permits</td><td>/property/buildingpermits</td><td>homeOwnerName</td><td>The name of the home owner or the person the work is for, as specified on the permit.</td><td>property.buildingPermits.homeOwnerName</td></tr>

<tr><td>Property Building Permits</td><td>/property/buildingpermits</td><td>pubDate</td><td>The publish date of the source data this record belongs to</td><td>property.vintage.pubDate</td></tr>

<!--SaleSnapshot-->  
 <tr><td>Sale Snapshot</td><td>/sale/snapshot</td><td>Id</td><td>ATTOM's legacy property property identifier (will be deprecated)</td><td>property.identifier.Id</td></tr>

For counties where recorder's data is available, an effort is made to have the SA_PARCEL_NBR_PRIMARY be the same identifier as is commonly found on the documents.</td><td>PROPERTY._IDENTIFICATION.@AssessorsParcelIdentifier</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Foreclosure Details</td><td>/preforeclosuredetails</td><td>auctionPostDirection</td><td>The post-directional of the location of the foreclosure auction.</td><td>Auction.auctionPostDirection </td></tr>

 <tr><td>Foreclosure Details</td><td>/preforeclosuredetails</td><td>defaultAmount</td><td>Total amount of payments in arrears, or delinquent.</td><td>Default.defaultAmount </td></tr>

Pre-dates the recording date.  In some cases, may be the Notary Date.  Formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.</td><td>Default.foreclosureInstrumentDate </td></tr>

 <tr><td>Foreclosure Details</td><td>/preforeclosuredetails</td><td>lenderAddressState</td><td>The lender address state.</td><td>Default.lenderAddressState </td></tr>

 <tr><td>Foreclosure Details</td><td>/preforeclosuredetails</td><td>lenderAddressZIP</td><td>The lender address Zip Code.</td><td>Default.lenderAddressZIP </td></tr>
 <tr><td>Foreclosure Details</td><td>/preforeclosuredetails</td><td>lenderNameFullStandardized</td><td>Full lender name, standardized to manage abbreviations, remove mis-spelling, etc.  Partner field to Lender code.  Can be used for lender matching.</td><td>Default.lenderNameFullStandardized </td></tr>
 <tr><td>Foreclosure Details</td><td>/preforeclosuredetails</td><td>lenderPhone</td><td>Phone number of the lender.</td><td>Default.lenderPhone </td></tr>

  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>propLandUse</td>
  <td>Universal use code identifying the property type</td>
  <td>property.summary.propLandUse</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>propIndicator</td>
  <td>Generalized property type grouping</td>
  <td>property.summary.propIndicator</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>universalSize</td>
  <td>Derived living or building square footage</td>
  <td>property.building.size.universalSize</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>bathsTotal</td>
  <td>The total number of rooms that are utilized as bathrooms (Includes partial 
    bathrooms and value may be interpreted)</td>
  <td>property.building.rooms.bathsTotal</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>beds</td>
  <td>The total number of rooms that can be qualified as bedrooms</td>
  <td>property.building.rooms.beds</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>lastModified</td>
  <td>The date the record was last modified</td>
  <td>property.vintage.lastModified</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>pubDate</td>

</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>eventDate</td>
  <td>The date when the value was determined.</td>
  <td>property.avm.eventDate</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>

</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>

</tr>

  <td>Home Equity</td>

</tr>

  <td>Home Equity</td>

</tr>

  <td>Home Equity</td>

  <td>ratioTaxValue</td>

</tr>

  <td>Home Equity</td>

</tr>

  <td>Home Equity</td>

</tr>

  <td>Home Equity</td>
