  <td>rangePctOfValue</td>
  <td>Percent of Value Range the Target Value Represents.</td>
  <td>property.avm.calculations.rangePctOfValue</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>LTV</td>
  <td>Loan To Value calculated by dividing the sum of currently open loan amounts by the AVM value for the property</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.LTV</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>estimatedAvailableEquity</td>
  <td> The difference between the current market value represented by the AVM value and the sum of the current outstanding loan amounts.</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.estimatedAvailableEquity</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>estimatedLendableEquity</td>
  <td>80% of the difference between the current market value represented by the AVM value and the sum of the current outstanding loan amounts</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.estimatedLendableEquity</td>
</tr>

<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>firstAmortizedLoanAmount</td>
  <td>NA</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.firstAmortizedLoanAmount</td>
</tr>

<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>secondAmortizedLoanAmount</td>
  <td>NA</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.secondAmortizedLoanAmount</td>
</tr>

<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>thirdAmortizedLoanAmount</td>
  <td>NA</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.thirdAmortizedLoanAmount</td>
</tr>

<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>totalEstimatedLoanBalance</td>
  <td>Based on the ATTOM Data Solution's Loan Model algorithm, the sum of open loans in first, second and third lien positions.</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.totalEstimatedLoanBalance</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td>Home Equity</td>
  <td>/valuation/homeequity/</td>
  <td>recordLastUpdated</td>
  <td>The last update date for the record in YYYY-MM-DD format.</td>
  <td>property.homeEquity.recordLastUpdated</td>
</tr>
				</tbody>
                </table>
                </div></p>
                <p>
                <div class="page-important-box">
                  <strong>Want all fields to be returned?</strong><br/><br/>
                  All fields that are null are omitted in the JSON response by default. If you would like the JSON response to include the null fields, just add "&debug=True" to the end of the API call URL. <br/><br/>
                  <p>Example:</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/property/detail?address1=210+Hammerking+Rd&address2=Dallas+TX+75232&debug=True </code></pre>
				</div>
			  </p>

		      	   
             		
            </div> <!-- end block -->    

            <hr>

            <div class="block">
              <h2 id="area">Area API</h2>                
              <h3 id="areaOverview" class="page-subtopics">Overview</h3> 
              <p>The Area API helps users explore the relationships between various geographic areas, offering access to data such as area boundaries (polygons) and area IDs. This data spans across multiple geographic units, from counties and zip codes to residential subdivisions and school attendance areas.</p>
              <p>By leveraging the Area API, users can gain a comprehensive understanding of how different areas are connected, facilitating informed decision-making related to spatial relationships and regional planning.</p>
              
                   
                            <p>
                <div class="table-responsive">
                  <table class="table table-hover">
                    <thead>
                      <tr>
                        <th>Data Type</th>
                        <th>Abbreviation</th>
                        <th>Definition</th>
                      </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                      <tr>
                        <td>State</td>
                        <td>ST</td>
                        <td>Boundaries for each of the 50 states as well as the District of Columbia and the US territories.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>County</td>
                        <td>CO</td>
                        <td>County subdivisons are smaller geographic units of a county mostly comprised of townships and towns.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>County Subdivision</td>
                        <td>CS</td>
                        <td>County subdivisons are smaller geographic units of a county mostly comprised of townships and towns.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>Place</td>
                        <td>PL</td>
                        <td>Comprised of incorporated places and census designated places.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>Zip Code Tabulation Area</td>
                        <td>ZI</td>
                        <td>Boundaries for Zip Code Tabulation Areas (ZCTAs) in the U.S.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>Macro Neighborhood</td>
                        <td>N1</td>
                        <td>Macro-Neighborhoods are the largest neighborhood type by size and usually depict regions, major sections of a city, or large master planned communities.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>Neighborhood</td>
                        <td>N2</td>
                        <td>This level represents the common definition of a city-level neighborhood, typically comprised of a colloquial grouping of streets and commonly referenced by local residents.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>Sub-Neighborhood</td>
                        <td>N3</td>
                        <td>Sub-Neighborhoods typically represent smaller named areas with an existing level 2 neighborhood. These are usually found in the core of the city and are often business, financial, entertainment, arts, cultural, or historic districts.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>Residential Subdivision</td>
                        <td>N4</td>
                        <td>Comprised primarily of boundaries for subdivisions, condominiums, townhome communities, apartment complexes, retirement communities, mobile home parks, and other residential housing tracts.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>School District Boundary</td>
                        <td>DB</td>
                        <td>Boundaries for school district in the U.S.</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>School Attendance Area Boundary</td>
                        <td>SB</td>
                        <td>Boundaries that identify the geographic areas served by each regular public school in the U.S.</td>
                      </tr>
                    </tbody>
                  </table>
				</div>  
              </p>
		           


              <h3 id="areaInteractiveDocs" name="areaInteractiveDocs" class="page-subtopics">Interactive Docs</h3> 
         
              <p>
                
                	
                   <div id="swagger-ui-container-area-api">
              	   </div>			 
              </p>  				  	
			  <br /><br /><br />     


              <h3 id="areaAPIStructure" name="areaAPIStructure" class="page-subtopics">API Structure</h3> 
              
			                                 
              <p>The main endpoint for the Area API is:</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/areaapi/v2.0.0</code></pre>  
			  <p>Example</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/areaapi/v2.0.0/county/lookup?StateId=ST36</code></pre>
              <h4>Headers</h4>
              <p>There are two required headers:</p>     
              <p>
                 <ol>
                   <li>Accept - set to either
                        <ol type="a">
                          <li>application/json</li>	
                          <li>application/xml</li>
                        </ol>  
                   </li>
                   <li>APIKey - include the API Key assigned to you.</li>                   
                 </ol>
              </p> 
			  <p>
                <div class="page-important-box">
                  <strong>Only GeoJSON and WKT formats are supported.</strong> 	
				</div>
			  </p>
			  <h4>Resources</h4>
			  <p>This API contains two primary resources for interacting with ATTOM geographic data:</p>
			  <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover">
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Area Hierarchy</td>
                                                    <td>This resource allows you to determine all of the areas a specific geographic point falls within.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Area Lookups</td>
                                                    <td>Use Lookups to understand the relationships between two specific types of areas. For example, counties within a state.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
			  </p> 			  
			  <p>
                <div class="page-important-box">
                  You can try out these calls in our <strong>Interactive Docs</strong>. 	
				</div>
			  </p>	
              <p><h5>Area Hierarchy</h5></p>
              <p><strong>Neighborhood Boundaries</strong></p>
              <p>Neighborhood Boundaries delineate the geographies that matter most to customers in the areas where people live, work, and socialize. Whether you need a simple lookup of neighborhood names or want a more meaningful way to organize and present map data, this dataset is considered the industry standard by web and mobile organizations across the globe.</p>
              <br/>    
              <p><strong>Residential Boundaries</strong></p>
              <p>Residential Boundaries provide data about the residential areas in and around metros. These boundaries delineate neighborhoods with houses, condos, and apartment complexes, and exclude those with commercial, industrial, or public spaces.</p>
			                   
              <p><h5>Census Hierarchy</h5></p>
              <p><strong>Incorporated Places</strong></p>
              <p>Places always are within a single state or equivalent entity, but may extend across county and county subdivision boundaries. An incorporated place usually is a city, town, village, or borough, but can have other legal descriptions.</p>
              <br/>
              <p><strong>County Subdivisions</strong></p>
              <p>County Subdivisions are the primary divisions of counties and equivalent entities. They include census county divisions, census subareas, minor civil divisions, and unorganized territories and can be classified as either legal or statistical. *NOTE: ATTOM has chosen to use either Census Place OR County Subdivision boundaries in certain areas where the geography type best fits the local understanding and designation of geographies.</p>   
			  <p> 
                <br/>
                <div class="page-important-box">
                  <strong>What kinds of questions can data from the Area API help answer?</strong>
                  <br/><br/>
                  <ul>
                   <li>What neighborhood, zip code or place does this point or address fall within?</li>
                    <li>What is the boundary for a given GEO ID?</li>
                    <li>Tell me all the counties within this state.</li>
                    <li>Tell me all the CBSAs within this state. </li>
				</div>
			  </p>				  

<h4>Standard Response Information</h4>
<p>A standard response from the area API will include the following structure to help you handle different response codes and number of records. This can be found at the bottom of the response:</p>
<p>{</p>
<p> "xml_record": "50"</p> 
<p>},</p>
<p>"status": {</p>
<p>	"code": "0",</p>
<p>	"long_description": "Your request was successfully processed.",</p>
<p> "short_description": "Success",</p>
<p>	},</p>
<p>	"xmlns": "https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/area"</p>
<p> }</p>
<p>}</p>
<div id="areaSearchFilter"></div>
			  <h4>Search Filters</h4>			  
			  <p>
     <p>In addition to Resources and Packages, there are also a number of other filters that may be added to a request to help narrow down results. The filters and some examples of how they might be used are outlined below.</p>
                                    <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover dataTable">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Path</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Type</th>
                                                  <th>Description</th>
                                                  <th>Example</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Possible values</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                 <tr><td>Area Hierarchy Lookup </td><td>	/areaapi/area/hierarchy/lookup </td><td>wktstring </td><td>Single value </td><td>WKTString Parameters </td><td>wktstring=POINT(-75.1652215,39.9525839)</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area Hierarchy Lookup </td><td>	/areaapi/area/hierarchy/lookup </td><td>geotype </td><td>Single value </td><td>known Geo Type </td><td>geotype=PZ</td><td>All,PZ,SB,DB,ZI,N1,N2,N3,N4,ST,CO,PL,CB</td></tr>
<tr><td>Area Hierarchy Lookup </td><td>	/areaapi/area/hierarchy/lookup </td><td>latitutude </td><td>Single value </td><td>The property latitude coordinate	</td><td>latitude=32.8093195 & longitude=-117.0116626</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area Hierarchy Lookup </td><td> /areaapi/area/hierarchy/lookup </td><td>longitude </td><td>Single value	</td><td>The property longitude coordinate	</td><td>latitude=32.8093195 & longitude=-117.0116626</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area State Lookup </td><td>/areaapi/area/state/lookup </td><td>	geoIdV4</td><td>Multi-value </td><td>Geocode requested</td><td>geoIdV4=25c781485c834372b7e7b7ef0fc0c2fa</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td>Area State Lookup </td><td>/areaapi/area/state/lookup </td><td>	AreaId</td><td>Multi-value </td><td>known Geo ID </td><td>AreaId=ZI98648</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area Boundary Detail </td><td>/areaapi/area/boundary/detail </td><td>geoIdV4 </td><td>Multi-value </td><td>Geocode requested</td><td>geoIdV4=25c781485c834372b7e7b7ef0fc0c2fa</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area Boundary Detail </td><td>/areaapi/area/boundary/detail </td><td>AreaId </td><td>Multi-value </td><td>known Geo ID </td><td>AreaId=ZI98648</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area Boundary Detail </td><td>/areaapi/area/boundary/detail </td><td>format	</td><td> Single value </td><td>Boundaries format</td><td> format=geojson </td><td>geojson,wkt</td></tr>
<tr><td>Area GeoCode Lookup </td><td>/areaapi/area/geoId/legacyLookup </td><td>	geoIdV4 </td><td>Multi-value </td><td>Geocode requested	</td><td>geoIdV4=25c781485c834372b7e7b7ef0fc0c2fa</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area GeoCode Lookup </td><td>/areaapi/area/geoId/legacyLookup </td><td>	geoId </td><td>	Multi-value </td><td>known Geo ID </td><td>geoId=ZI98648</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area GeoID Lookup </td><td>/areaapi/area/geoId/legacyLookup </td><td>geoIdV4</td><td>Multi-value</td><td>Geocode requested</td><td>geoIdV4=25c781485c834372b7e7b7ef0fc0c2fa<td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area GeoID Lookup </td><td>/areaapi/area/geoId/Lookup </td><td>	geoId </td><td>	Multi-value </td><td>known Geo ID </td><td>geoId=ZI98648</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>	
<tr><td>Area GeoID Lookup </td><td>/areaapi/area/geoId/Lookup </td><td>	geotype	</td><td> Single value </td><td>known Geo Type </td><td>geotype=PZ</td><td>	All,PZ,SB,DB,ZI,N1,N2,N3,N4,ST,CO,PL,CB</td></tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
                </p> 
								<h4>Search Filter Example</h4>
                                <p>The following example returns a list of geographies that point falls within. Required input is a valid lat/long or WKT (Well Known Text).<pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/areaapi/v4/hierarchy/lookup?WKTString=POINT(-71.5776%2041.66895)&geoType=ZI</code></pre></p>
		       

			  <h3 id="areaStatusCodes" class="page-subtopics">Status Codes</h3> 
				
			                                 
              <p>Beyond the standard HTTP codes, you will find custom status codes in the response body.</p>	
		      <p>
                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                         <table class="table table-striped">
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>-1</td>
                                                    <td>Database Connection Failed</td>
						    <td>Could not open Database Connection</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>-2</td>
                                                    <td>SQL Command Failed</td>
						    <td>SQL command execution failed</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>0</td>
                                                    <td>Success</td>
						    <td>Your request was successfully processed</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>100</td>
                                                    <td>One or more input parameters are invalid or missing</td>
						    <td>One or more input parameters are invalid or missing</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>4100</td>
                                                    <td>Invalid WKT</td>
						    <td>The WKT is invalid</td>
                                                </tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>                
              </p>
		       
								
              <h3 id="areaDataDictionary" class="page-subtopics">Data Dictionary</h3> 
              
			                                 
              <p>This data dictionary represents all of the fields currently available in the Area API.</p> 
              <p><div class="table-responsive">
 <table class="table table-striped dataTable">
 <thead>
        <tr>
            <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Name</th>
			<th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Path</th>
            <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Field Name</th>
            <th>Description</th>
			<th style="white-space: nowrap;">JSON Path</th>
        </tr>
</thead>
 <tbody>
 <tr><td>Hierarchy Lookup</td><td>/hierarchy/lookup</td><td>area</td><td>Area measurement</td><td>response.result.package.item.area</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Hierarchy Lookup</td><td>/hierarchy/lookup</td><td>area_unit</td><td>Units for area measurement</td><td>response.result.package.item.area_unit </td></tr>
 <tr><td>Hierarchy Lookup</td><td>/hierarchy/lookup</td><td>geo_Key</td><td>Full geographic identifier used for searching. Not recommended to display</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_Key</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Hierarchy Lookup</td><td>/hierarchy/lookup</td><td>id</td><td>Fully formatted geography ID.</td><td>response.result.package.item.id</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Hierarchy Lookup</td><td>/hierarchy/lookup</td><td>name</td><td>Suggested value to use for text search, drop-downs and other search controls</td><td>response.result.package.item.name </td></tr>
 <tr><td>Hierarchy Lookup</td><td>/hierarchy/lookup</td><td>type</td><td>Standard Attom geography type code</td><td>response.result.package.item.type</td></tr>
<tr><td>Hierarchy Lookup</td><td>/hierarchy/lookup</td><td>community_data_available</td><td>Indicates if community data is available for the selected region</td><td>response.result.package.item.community_data_available</td></tr>   
 
 <tr><td>CBSA Lookup</td><td>/cbsa/lookup</td><td>geo_center_latitude</td><td>Latitude component of centroid</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_center_latitude</td></tr>
 <tr><td>CBSA Lookup</td><td>/cbsa/lookup</td><td>geo_center_longitude</td><td>Longitude component of centroid</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_center_longitude</td></tr>
 <tr><td>CBSA Lookup</td><td>/cbsa/lookup</td><td>geo_key</td><td>Full geographic identifier used for searching. Not recommended to display</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_key</td></tr>
 <tr><td>CBSA Lookup</td><td>/cbsa/lookup</td><td>id</td><td>Fully formatted geography ID.</td><td>response.result.package.item.id</td></tr>
 <tr><td>CBSA Lookup</td><td>/cbsa/lookup</td><td>name</td><td>Suggested value to use for text search, drop-downs and other search controls</td><td>response.result.package.item.name</td></tr>
 <tr><td>CBSA Lookup</td><td>/cbsa/lookup</td><td>type</td><td>Standard Attom geography type code</td><td>response.result.package.item.type</td></tr>

 <tr><td>Geo ID Lookup</td><td>/geoid/lookup</td><td>area</td><td>Area measurement</td><td>response.result.package.item.area</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Geo ID Lookup</td><td>/geoid/lookup</td><td>area_unit</td><td>Units for area measurement</td><td>response.result.package.item.area_unit </td></tr>
 <tr><td>Geo ID Lookup</td><td>/geoid/lookup</td><td>geo_Key</td><td>Full geographic identifier used for searching. Not recommended to display</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_Key</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Geo ID Lookup</td><td>/geoid/lookup</td><td>id</td><td>Fully formatted geography ID.</td><td>response.result.package.item.id</td></tr>
 <tr><td>Geo ID Lookup</td><td>/geoid/lookup</td><td>name</td><td>Suggested value to use for text search, drop-downs and other search controls</td><td>response.result.package.item.name </td></tr>
 <tr><td>Geo ID Lookup</td><td>/geoid/lookup</td><td>type</td><td>Standard Attom geography type code</td><td>response.result.package.item.type</td></tr>
 
 <tr><td>County Lookup</td><td>/county/lookup</td><td>geo_center_latitude</td><td>Latitude component of centroid</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_center_latitude</td></tr>
 <tr><td>County Lookup</td><td>/county/lookup</td><td>geo_center_longitude</td><td>Longitude component of centroid</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_center_longitude</td></tr>
 <tr><td>County Lookup</td><td>/county/lookup</td><td>geo_key</td><td>Full geographic identifier used for searching. Not recommended to display</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_key</td></tr>
 <tr><td>County Lookup</td><td>/county/lookup</td><td>id</td><td>Fully formatted geography ID.</td><td>response.result.package.item.id</td></tr>
 <tr><td>County Lookup</td><td>/county/lookup</td><td>name</td><td>Suggested value to use for text search, drop-downs and other search controls</td><td>response.result.package.item.name</td></tr>
 <tr><td>County Lookup</td><td>/county/lookup</td><td>type</td><td>Standard Attom geography type code</td><td>response.result.package.item.type</td></tr>
 
 <tr><td>State Lookup</td><td>/state/lookup/</td><td>abbreviation</td><td>Two letter state abbreviation</td><td>response.result.package.item.abbreviation</td><td></td></tr>
 <tr><td>State Lookup</td><td>/state/lookup/</td><td>geo_center_latitude</td><td>Latitude component of centroid</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_center_latitude</td></tr>
 <tr><td>State Lookup</td><td>/state/lookup/</td><td>geo_center_longitude</td><td>Longitude component of centroid</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_center_longitude</td></tr>
 <tr><td>State Lookup</td><td>/state/lookup/</td><td>geo_key</td><td>Full geographic identifier used for searching. Not recommended to display</td><td>response.result.package.item.geo_key</td></tr>
 <tr><td>State Lookup</td><td>/state/lookup/</td><td>id</td><td>Fully formatted geography ID.</td><td>response.result.package.item.id</td></tr>
 <tr><td>State Lookup</td><td>/state/lookup/</td><td>name</td><td>Suggested value to use for text search, drop-downs and other search controls</td><td>response.result.package.item.name</td></tr>
 <tr><td>State Lookup</td><td>/state/lookup/</td><td>type</td><td>Standard Attom geography type code</td><td>response.result.package.item.type</td></tr>  </table>             
<p>
<div class="page-important-box">
<strong>Which is better, full dataset file delivery or data access via API?</strong><br/><br/>
Neither, they are just different. The best choice for you depends on the resources you have available and the type of format you are looking for. Some companies don't have the staff or infrastructure in place to support ongoing map database management so the API is the best way for them to access geographic data.<br/><br/>
Interested in learning more? <strong><a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com">Contact us</a></strong> today to discuss your business’s needs.
</div></p>
		       
										
			  
            </div> <!-- end block -->  
            <hr>

<div class="block">
              <h2 id="poi">POI API</h2>                
              <h3 id="poiOverview" class="page-subtopics">Overview</h3> 
              <p>The Points of Interest (POI) API enables users to access data on public and private establishments based on specific location parameters, such as address or latitude and longitude. With around 15 million establishments in the database, the API allows users to perform lookups to gather additional information on each location. All points of interest are geocoded, ensuring that they can be easily displayed on a map for visualization.</p>
  
              <h3 id="poiInteractiveDocs" class="page-subtopics">Interactive Docs</h3> 
			  <p>

                 
                 <div id="swagger-ui-container-poi-api">
                 </div>

              </p>  
              <br /><br /><br />
              <h3 id="poiAPIStructure" class="page-subtopics">API Structure</h3> 
              
                                             
              <p>The main endpoint for the Points of Interest API is:</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/neighborhood/</code></pre>  
			  <p>Example</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/neighborhood/poi/categorylookup?category=TRAVEL&lineOfBusiness=TRANSPORTATION</code></pre>
              <h4>Headers</h4>
              <p>There are two required headers:</p>     
              <p>
                 <ol>
                   <li>Accept - set to either
                        <ol type="a">
                          <li>application/json</li>	
                          <li>application/xml</li>
                        </ol>  
                   </li>
                   <li>APIKey - include the API Key assigned to you.</li>
                 </ol>
              </p> 
			  <h4>Resources</h4>
			  <p>This API contains three primary resources for interacting with ATTOM points of interest data:</p>
			  <p>
									<div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover">
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Street Address</td>
                                                    <td>This search returns a list of POIs in proximity to an address.</td>
                                                </tr>                                            
                                                    <td>Geography</td>
                                                    <td>This search returns a list of POI in proximity to the centroid of a zip code.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Point</td>
                                                    <td>This search returns a list of POI in proximity to a lat/long. Format should be written as follows: POINT(-74.019215,40.706554)
</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
			  </p> 	
			  <h4>Default Behavior</h4>
			  <h5>Record Limit</h5>
		      <p>The API’s response defaults to 20 Points of Interest per call. You can change this by adding a parameter called <strong>"RecordLimit"</strong> to your request.</p>
              <br/> 
              <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/poisearch/v2.0.0/poi/Street+Address/?streetaddress=90+broad+street,+new+york,+ny;+10004&recordlimit=50</code></pre> 
			  <p>
			  <h5>Search Radius</h5>
		      <p>The API default search distance is 5 square miles from the address, point or zip code entered. To increase or decrease this default add a parameter called <strong>"SearchDistance"</strong> to your request.</p>
              <br/>
              <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/poisearch/v2.0.0/poi/Street+Address/?streetaddress=90+broad+street,+new+york,+ny;+10004&searchdistance=2</code></pre>
			  <h5>Street Address Format</h5>
		      <p>A valid street address must be entered for results to be returned. The following format should be used: address number and street name, city, state; zip code</p>
              <br/>
              <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/poisearch/v2.0.0/poi/Street+Address/?streetaddress=90+broad+street,+new+york,+ny;+10004</code></pre>

					<h4>Filtering</h4>
			  		<p>The table below shows the different fields that can be used to filter responses from the /poi/point call. Try this out in the <strong>Interative Docs</strong>.</p>
				<p>
                <div class="table-responsive">
                  <table class="table table-hover">
                    <tbody>
                      <tr>
                        <td>BUSINESSCATEGORY</td>
                        <td>Business category of the POI (14 available)</td>
                      </tr>
                    </tbody>
                  </table>
				</div>
			    </p>	
					<h4>Sorting Options</h4>
			  		<p>The table below shows the different columns that can be sorted in the POI API outputs. Try this out in the <strong>Interative Docs</strong>.</p>			  
				<p>
                <div class="table-responsive">
                  <table class="table table-hover">
                    <tbody>
                      <tr>
                        <td>NAME</td>
                        <td>Name of the POI</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>DISTANCE</td>
                        <td>Distance of the POI fromt the search point</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>BUSINESSCATEGORY</td>
                        <td>Business category of the POI (14 available)</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr>
                        <td>LOB</td>
                        <td>Line of business of the POI (120 available)</td>
                      </tr>
                    </tbody>
                  </table>
				</div>
			  </p>				  

			  <h4>Business Categories</h4>
              <p>These are 14 business categories that exist in the Point of Interest API. They are:
                 <ol>
                   <li>ATTRACTIONS – RECREATION</li>
                   <li>AUTOMOTIVE SERVICES</li>
                   <li>BANKS – FINANCIAL</li>
                   <li>EATING – DRINKING</li>
                   <li>EDUCATION</li>
                   <li>FARM – RANCH</li>
                   <li>GOVERNMENT – PUBLIC</li>
                   <li>HEALTH CARE SERVICES</li>
                   <li>HOSPITALITY</li>
                   <li>ORGANIZATIONS – ASSOCIATIONS</li>
                   <li>PERSONAL SERVICES</li>
                   <li>PET SERVICES</li>
                   <li>SHOPPING</li>
                   <li>TRAVEL</li>
				 </ol>
			  </p>

			  <h4>Helpers</h4>
			  <p>We also provide three lookups to help you better understand the business categories that a POI may be classified under.</p>
			  <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover">
                                            <tbody>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Business Categories</td>
                                                    <td>This lookup is used to obtain a full list of business categories. </td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Lines of Business (LOB)</td>
                                                    <td>This lookup can be used to get the list of LOBs that are in the system. A Line of Business belongs to a business category. A list of all available lines of business can be found at the end of POI documentation.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>Geography</td>
                                                    <td>This search returns a list of POI in proximity to the centroid of a zip code.</td>
                                                </tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
			  </p>  
              <br/> 
			  <h4>Implementation Tips</h4>
<p><strong>Business Duplication</strong>: Establishments are often associated with multiple business types or categories. For example, a Home Depot might be considered a hardware store, a garden center or an appliance store. When a business belongs to multiple business classifications, we deliver the business to you multiple times. Each instance of that business will have the same OB_ID.</p>
<p><strong>The PRIMARY field can be used to determine the primary business practice at the location</strong>. If your goal is to display a set of unique businesses near a property we suggest you filter out any records from the display where PRIMARY = “OTHER”. This will ensure that each business is only listed once.</p>
			  <p>

                 
                 <div id="swagger-ui-container-poi-api">
                 </div>

              </p>
<br/>
<h4>Standard Response Information</h4>
<p>A standard response from the POI API will include the following structure to help you handle different response codes and number of records. This can be found at the bottom of the response:</p>
<p>{</p>
<p> "xml_record": "20"</p> 
<p>},</p>
<p>"status": {</p>
<p>	"code": "0",</p>
<p>	"long_description": "Your request was successfully processed.",</p>
<p> "short_description": "Success",</p>
<p>	},</p>
<p>	"xmlns": "https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/poisearch/v2.0.0"</p>
<p> }</p>
<p>}</p>
<div id="poiSearchFilter"></div>
			  <h4>Search Filters</h4>			  
			  <p>
     <p>In addition to Resources and Packages, there are also a number of other filters that may be added to a request to help narrow down results. The filters and some examples of how they might be used are outlined below.</p>
                                    <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover dataTable">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Path</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Type</th>
                                                  <th>Description</th>
                                                  <th>Example</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Possible values</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                 <tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	point </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is the Point value </td><td>POINT(-74.019215,40.706554)</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	radius </td><td>Single value </td><td>Circular radius distance in miles Note: May be used in conjunction with Latitude / Longitude or Address input </td><td>radius=5</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	address </td><td>Single value </td><td>The property address </td><td>address=2308 Wentworth St</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	categoryName </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is Category Name of the POI. </td><td>categoryName=PERSONAL SERVICES</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	LineOfBusinessName </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is Business category of the POI. </td><td> LineOfBusinessName=MISC SERVICES</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	IndustryName </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is Industry Name of the POI. </td><td>IndustryName=CARGO SERVICE</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	categoryId </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is Category ID of the POI. </td><td>categoryId=1952</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI </td><td>/neighborhood/poi </td><td>	zipCode </td><td>Single value </td><td>The Mailing Address Zip Code. </td><td>zipCode=60614</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI Category Lookup </td><td>/neighborhood/poi/categorylookup </td><td>industry </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is Industry Name of the POI.</td><td>Industry=CARGO SERVICE</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI Category Lookup </td><td>/neighborhood/poi/categorylookup </td><td>category </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is Category of the POI.</td><td>category=PERSONAL SERVICES</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td> Neighborhood POI Category Lookup </td><td>/neighborhood/poi/categorylookup </td><td>lineofbusiness </td><td>Single value </td><td>This is Business category of the POI. </td><td>LineOfBusiness=MISC SERVICES</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
                </p> 
								<h4>Search Filter Example</h4>
                                <p>The following example returns industry, 
category and lineofbusiness based POI details.<pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/neighborhood/poi/categorylookup?industry=BIOTECHNOLOGY&category=HEALTH CARE&lineOfBusiness=MISC</code></pre></p>
		       
              
              <h3 id="poiStatusCodes" class="page-subtopics">Status Codes</h3> 
             		  
                                             
               <p>The following table highlights the expected status codes from the system. Beyond standard HTTP codes you will find custom status codes in the “Status” element of the response body.
</p>	
		      <p>
                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                         <table class="table table-striped">
                                            <tbody>                            
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>3</td>
                                                    <td>Address Geocoded fail</td>
                                                    <td>The address entered could not be geocoded</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>5</td>
                                                    <td>There are no POIs within the zip code entered</td>
                                                    <td>&nbsp;</td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>100</td>
                                                    <td>One or more input parameters are invalid or missing</td>
                                                    <td>&nbsp;</td>
                                                </tr>                                              
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>                
              </p>  
		       
			  
              <h3 id="poiDataDictionary" class="page-subtopics">Data Dictionary</h3> 
              			
			                                 
              <p>This data dictionary represents all of the fields currently available in the Points of Interest API.</p>

                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>

<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>state</td><td>The two character state abbreviation for the listing</td><td>poi.details.state</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>zip</td><td>The zip code for the listing</td><td>poi.details.zip</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>zip4</td><td>The zip code + 4 for the listing</td><td>poi.details.zip4</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>dpc</td><td>A delivery point code is a specific set of digits between 00 and 99 assigned
to every address. When combined with the ZIP + 4 code, the delivery
point provides a unique identifier for every deliverable address served
by the USPS. A one digit checksum is appended.</td><td>poi.details.dpc</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>carrierRoute</td><td>A postal carrier route is a group of addresses that receive the same USPS
code for mail delivery. The postal carrier route codes are represented as
4 digits: one letter for the carrier route type, and three numbers for the
carrier route code. For example, ""C047"" or ""R004."" The meaning of the
letters is as follows:</td><td>poi.details.carrierRoute</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>fipsStateCode</td><td>The Federal Information Processing Standard state code for the listing. Ex. IL=17</td><td>poi.details.fipsStateCode</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>countyCode</td><td>The Federal Information Processing Standard county code for the listing</td><td>poi.details.countyCode</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>censusTract</td><td>The Census Tract (CT) for the listing. CTs are small, relatively permanent statistical
subdivisions of a county or equivalent entity that are updated by local participants
prior to each decennial census as part of the Census Bureau's Participant Statistical
Areas Program.</td><td>poi.details.censusTract</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>censusBlockGroup</td><td>The Census Block Group (CBG) for the listing. CBGs are are statistical divisions of
census tracts, are generally defined to contain between 600 and 3,000 people, and
are used to present data and control block numbering. Census Block Groups have
a valid code range of 0 through 9.</td><td>poi.details.censusBlockGroup</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>censusBlockID</td><td>The Census Block ID (CBID) for the listing.</td><td>poi.details.censusBlockID</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>cbsa</td><td>The Core Based Statistical Area (CBSA) for the listing. A CBSA is a U.S. geographic area
defined by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) that consists of one or more counties
(or equivalents) anchored by an urban center of at least 10,000 people plus adjacent counties
that are socioeconomically tied to the urban center by commuting.</td><td>poi.details.cbsa</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>sic1_4</td><td>Primary standard industry classification (SIC) 4 digit</td><td>poi.details.sic1_4</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>sic1_8</td><td>Primary standard industry classification (SIC) 8 digit</td><td>poi.details.sic1_8</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>industryClassification</td><td>Industry classification (SIC ranges). Code for first 2 positions of the primary SIC</td><td>poi.details.industryClassification</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>mlsc</td><td>Code indicating the source data for the listing. 1=White Pages (WP) only, 2=Yellow Pages (YP) only, 3=Other Only, 4=WP and YP and Other, 5=WP and YP, 6=WP and Other, 7=YP and Other, 8=Direct from Business Owner</td><td>poi.details.mlsc</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>areaCode</td><td>The telephone area code for the listing</td><td>poi.details.areaCode</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>exchange</td><td>The telephone exchange number for the listing</td><td>poi.details.exchange</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>phoneNumber</td><td>The last four digits of the telephone number for the listing</td><td>poi.details.phoneNumber</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>dso</td><td>Indicates if the area where the business is located observes daylight savings time. 0=No,1=Yes</td><td>poi.details.dso</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>timeZone</td><td>The time zone of the listing. 0 = not applicable 1 = Samoa 2 = Hawaii 3 = Alaska/ Yukon 4 = Pacific 5 = Mountain 6 = Central 7 = Eastern 8 = Atlantic 9 = Newfoundland</td><td>poi.details.timeZone</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>validationFlag</td><td>C = the phone number for the listing is validated as connected</td><td>poi.details.validationFlag</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>validationDate</td><td>The most recent date the phone number for the listing was verified as active (YYYYMMDD)</td><td>poi.details.validationDate</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>DPVConfirm</td><td>Determination by the USPS whether mail is able to be delivered or not delivered at the address of the listing.</td><td>poi.details.DPVConfirm</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>executiveTitleCode</td><td>Code for standard executive title for the contact for the listing</td><td>poi.details.executiveTitleCode</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>latitude</td><td>Latitude with floating decimal - Examples:
-12.345678
-38.9447</td><td>poi.details.latitude</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>longitude</td><td>Longitude with floating decimal xxplicit Negative Sign - Examples:
(-123.456789)
( -123.4567)</td><td>poi.details.longitude</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>confidenceScore</td><td>The Confidence Score for the listing. The Confidence Score is a value that Localeze derives for each business listing in our data set.
The Confidence Score uses a probabilistic approach to help identify listings that have a higher likelihood of being open and are recognizable in the
real world using the name, address, and phone number combination provided in our data. It is not a definitive representation of accuracy, meaning there
will be some listings with a high Confidence Score that will be closed and/or have an inaccurate name/address/phone number combination.
However, the listings with a higher Confidence Score validate with a higher level accuracy compared to those with a lower Confidence Score.
In short, the Confidence Score achieves the ability to sort the listings in a way that can help minimize exposure to error.</td><td>poi.details.confidenceScore</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>ypHeading1</td><td>Top 6 normalized Localeze headings (where available)</td><td>poi.details.ypHeading1</td></tr>
<tr><td>Neighborhood POI</td><td>/neighborhood/poi</td><td>maximumYpAdSize</td><td>The size of the ad for a listing that was acquired via a Yellow Page advertisement.</td><td>poi.details.maximumYpAdSize</td></tr>

            <hr>

			<div class="block">
            <h2 id="comv4">Community API v4</h2>
              <h3 id="comOverviewv4" class="page-subtopics">Overview</h3>
              <p>The Community API provides access to extensive demographic, crime, natural disaster, air quality, and weather information across various geographic levels. This API offers rich data that can be integrated with other datasets to create a dynamic, personalized search experience for users. The demographic data is sourced from a wide range of public and private institutions, delivering critical insights into community characteristics.</p>
              
              <h3 id="comInteractiveDocsv4" class="page-subtopics">Interactive Docs</h3> 
			  <p>
                	             
                     <div id="swagger-ui-container-communityv4-api">
             		 </div>
              </p>
			  <br /><br /><br />
              <h3 id="comAPIStructurev4" class="page-subtopics">API Structure</h3> 
			  
			                              
              <p>The main endpoint for the Community API v4 is:</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/neighborhood</code></pre>  
			  <p>Example</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/neighborhood/community?geoIdV4=dd4ec3218a89807fc1c63dd7265cc1bc</code></pre>

<p>Location Lookup API endpoint:</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/location/lookup</code></pre>  
			  <p>Example</p>
			  <pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/location/lookup?name=Las%20Vegas</code></pre>

              <h4>Headers</h4>
              <p>There are two required headers:</p>     
              <p>
                 <ol>
                   <li>Accept - set to either
                        <ol type="a">
                          <li>application/json</li>	
                          <li>application/xml</li>
                        </ol>  
                   </li>
                   <li>APIKey - include the API Key assigned to you.</li>
                 </ol>
              </p> 
			  <h4>Resources</h4>
			  <p>This API has one resource available for interacting with demographic information. The resource, <strong>Community</strong>, returns the values for over 600 different attributes and includes information on population, household, employment, income, crime, temperature, ethnicity and much more. A full list of the attributes as well as the description and display names can be found in the data dictionary.</p>
              <p>Data is returned based on the specific geography in the request. All values are aggregated to the State, County, Census Place, County Subdivision, Zip Code or Neighborhood level.</p><br/>
<!--
			  <p>
                <div class="page-important-box">
                  <p>What are the codes for each geography?
                    <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
                      <th style="width:100px; text-decoration: underline; text-align: center;">Code</th>
                      <th style="text-decoration: underline; padding-left:1px;">Description</th>
                      <tr  style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">ST</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">State</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">CO</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">County</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">ZI</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">Zip Code Tabulation Area</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr  style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">SB</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">School Attendance Area</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr  style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">DB</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">School District Boundary</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">PL</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">Census Place</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">CS</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">County Subdivision</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">N1</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">Macro Neighborhood</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">N2</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">Neighborhood</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">N3</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">Sub-Neighborhood</td>
                      </tr>
                      <tr style="background-color:transparent;">
                        <td style="text-align: center; padding:1px;">N4</td>
                        <td style="padding:1px;">Residential Subdivision</td>
                      </tr>
                    </table>                     
                  	 <br/>
                     <strong>County Subdivision - States which use County Subdivision are: AK, CT, DC, ME, MA, NH, NJ, NY, RI and VT. All other states use Census Place.</strong>
                  </p>  
				</div>
			  </p>	
-->
			  <h4>GeoIDv4</h4>			  
			  <p>
                <div class="page-important-box">
                  <p>The GeoIDv4 parameter value is used to gain access to the community data. Running the Property API will return the GeoIDv4 values to use in the Community GeoIDv4 parameter. The Property API response will show the GeoIDv4 value in the JSON structure below.</p> 
                  <div style="display:block;">
                    <div style="display:block;">"location": {</div>
                   <div style="display:block; padding-left: 20px;">"geoid": "CO48061, CS4890480, DB4811680, PL4810768, RS0000195322, SB0000118928, SB0000118943, SB0000118954, SB0000154072, ZI78521",</div>
                    <div style="display:block; padding-left: 20px;"><b>"geoIdV4"</b>: {</div>
                    <div style="display:block; padding-left: 60px;">"ND": "ecb5529c9c43b6bba49a1087e2189b68",</div>
                    <div style="display:block; padding-left: 60px;">"SB": "712b44e372bc317839c7203b976bf0ee",</div>
                    <div style="display:block; padding-left: 60px;">"CS": "62e4a45c81aac571f195f83a8ff9a07e",</div>
                    <div style="display:block; padding-left: 60px;">"ZI":"cc3315052be263ddaa59d3faff0c5dc6"</div>
                    <div style="display:block; padding-left: 20px;">}</div>
                    <div style="display:block;">}</div>
                  </div>
				</div>
			  </p>
  </p>	
<div id="comSearchFilter"></div>
			  <h4>Search Filters</h4>			  
			  <p>
     <p>In addition to Resources and Packages, there are also a number of other filters that may be added to a request to help narrow down results. The filters and some examples of how they might be used are outlined below.</p>
                                    <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                        <table class="table table-hover dataTable">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Path</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Name</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Filter Type</th>
                                                  <th>Description</th>
                                                  <th>Example</th>
                                                  <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Possible values</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
                                                 <tr><td>Neighborhood Community </td><td> /neighborhood/community </td><td>GeoIdV4</td><td>Single value </td><td>ATTOM’s new geographic identifier</td><td>geoIdV4=dd4ec3218a89807fc1c63dd7265cc1bc</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>

<tr><td>Location Lookup	</td><td>/location/lookup </td><td>GeoIdV4 </td><td>Single value </td><td> ATTOM’s new geographic identifier	</td><td>geoIdV4=0026e28c13756d18e8736eaca64768ad</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td>Location Lookup	</td><td>/location/lookup </td><td>name </td><td>Single value</td><td>	This is the location name to search </td><td>name=Congressional District</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr><td>Location Lookup	</td><td>/location/lookup </td><td>geographyTypeAbbreviation	</td><td>Single value</td><td>This is the Geography type abbreviation</td><td>	geographyTypeAbbreviation=CD</td><td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>
                </p> 
								<h4>Search Filter Example</h4>
                                <p>The following example returns postal cities including "Las Vegas, NV" in their description.<pre><code>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/v4/location/lookup?geographyTypeAbbreviation=CI&name=Las Vegas, NV</code></pre></p>
		      

              <h3 id="comStatusCodesv4" class="page-subtopics">Status Codes</h3> 
              
			                              
              <p>The following table highlights the expected status codes from the system. Beyond standard HTTP codes you will find custom status codes in the “Status” element of the response body.
</p>	
		      <p>
                                    <div class="table-responsive">
                                         <table class="table table-striped">
                                            <tbody>                            
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>0</td>
                                                    <td>SuccessWithResult</td>
                                                    <td>Success with results.</td>
                                                  	<td></td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <td>1</td>
                                                    <td>SuccessWithoutResult</td>
                                                    <td>Success without results.</td>
                                                  	<td></td>
                                                </tr>
                                                <tr>
                                                     <td>-5</td>
                                                     <td>InvalidRequestParameter</td>
                                                     <td>Area based inputs were either missing or incomplete.</td>
	                                                 <td></td>
                                                 </tr>
                                              	 <tr>
                                                     <td>-6</td>
                                                     <td>MissingRequiredParameter</td>
                                                     <td>Missing geoIdv4 Parameter in Request.</td>
                                                     <td>/neighborhood/community</td>
                                                  </tr>
                                                  <tr>
                                                      <td>-6</td>
                                                      <td>MissingRequiredParameter</td>
                                                      <td>Missing Name Parameter in Request.</td>
                                                    <td>/location/lookup</td>
                                                   </tr>
                                            </tbody>
                                        </table>
                                    </div>                
              </p> 
		      
			  
              <h3 id="comDataDictionaryv4" class="page-subtopics">Attom API v4 Data Dictionary</h3> 
				
			                              
              <p>This data dictionary represents all of the fields currently available in the Community API v4.</p> 
              <p><div class="table-responsive">
                                         <table class="table table-striped dataTable">
                                            <thead>
                                                <tr>
                                                    <th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Name</th>
													<th style="white-space: nowrap;">API Endpoint Path</th>
                                                    <th style="white-space: nowrap;">Field Name</th>               
                                                    <th>Description</th>
                                                    <th style="white-space: nowrap;">JSON Path</th>
                                                </tr>
                                            </thead>
                                            <tbody>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>geoIDv4</td><td>GeoID</td><td>community.geography</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>geographyName</td><td>Geography Name</td><td>community.geography</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>geographyTypeName</td><td>Geography Type Name</td><td>community.geography</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>area_Square_Mile</td><td>Area Square Mile</td><td>community.geography</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>weather_index</td><td>Natural Disasters</td><td>community.naturaldisasters</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>earthquake_Index</td><td>Hail Index</td><td>community.naturaldisasters</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>hail_Index</td><td>Hurricane Index</td><td>community.naturaldisasters</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>hurricane_Index</td><td>Tornado Index</td><td>community.naturaldisasters</td></tr>

<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>wind_Index</td><td>Ozone Index</td><td>community.naturaldisasters</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>ozone_index</td><td>An invisible gas that irritates and impairs breathing. Index score (100=National Average).</td><td>community.airquality</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>lead_index</td><td>A metallic element used in products like solder and paint. Lead's presence in the air may be particularly harmful to the health of infants and children. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.airquality</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>carbon_monoxide_index</td><td>A colorless, odorless, highly poisonous gas formed by the incomplete combustion of carbon or a carbonaceous material, such as gasoline. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.airquality</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>nitrogen_dioxide_index</td><td>Poisonous brown gases, often found in auto exhaust fumes. It is a primary contributor to smog. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.airquality</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>particulate_matter_index</td><td>Fine particles of pollutants which tend to reduce visibility and invade the lungs deeply. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.airquality</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>air_pollution_index</td><td>A score that represents the relative air quality by combining indices of Ozone, Carbon Monoxide, Lead, Nitrogen Oxide, and Particulate matter and comparing to the national average of 100. A score of 200 indicates twice the presence of air pollutants than the national average, while 50 indicates half the presence. The different types of pollution are given equal weight in this score.</td><td>community.airquality</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>mortality_index</td><td>Mortality Index</td><td>community.crime</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>murder_index</td><td>Intentionally causing the death of another person without extreme provocation or legal justification at the County Level. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.crime</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>forcible_rape_index</td><td>Forced sexual intercourse index at the County Level. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.crime</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>forcible_robbery_index</td><td>The act of unlawfully taking the property of another by the use of violence or intimidation index at the County Level. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.crime</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>aggravated_assault_index</td><td>The act of unlawfully threatening or attempting to injure another at the County Level. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.crime</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>burglary_index</td><td>The act of entering a building or other premises with the intent to commit theft at the County Level. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.crime</td></tr>
<tr><td>neighborhood</td><td>neighborhood/community</td><td>larceny_index</td><td>The unlawful taking and removing of another's personal property with the intent of permanently depriving the owner at the County Level. Index score (100=National Average)</td><td>community.crime</td></tr>
