<hr>
<div class="block">
<h2 id="tileMain">PARCEL TILES API</h2>

<h3 id="tileOverview" class="page-subtopics">OVERVIEW</h3>
<p>This endpoint serves a nationwide parcel boundary layer in raster (PNG) format, which can be used with web mapping tools such as Mapbox GL and Leaflet.</p>

<h3 id="tileAuth" class="page-subtopics">AUTHENTICATION</h3>
  <p>Unlike other ATTOM API endpoints, the <code>/parceltiles</code> endpoint supports the authentication key <code>(apikey)</code> to be provided as a query parameter to support integration with common mapping tools, some of which may not support passing of request headers.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<p><code>/parceltiles/{z}/{x}/{y}.format?apikey=<ApiKey></code></p>
    
<h3 id="tileTiles" class="page-subtopics">TILES</h3>
  <p>The base path for this endpoint is <code>/parceltiles/{z}/{x}/{y}.format</code>. Supported format is PNG at present.
Tiles are available as far out as zoom level 14 and as close in as zoom level 18. Tiles outside of that range will return a 204 No Content response.<p>

<h3 id="tileUsage" class="page-subtopics">USAGE EXAMPLES</h3>
<h4 class="page-subtopics">Leaflet raster layer example</h4>
<p>To add raster tiles to a Leaflet map:</p>  
<div>
    <pre>
    <code>
L.tileLayer(
	'https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/parceltiles/{z}/{x}/{y}.png?apiKey=&lt;ApiKey&gt;'
).addTo(map)
	</code>
	</pre>
</div>

<h4 class="page-subtopics">ArcGIS Online (AGOL) and ArcGIS Desktop</h4>
<p>ArcGISOnline TiledLayer works with our raster tile layer, but the <code>{z}/{x}/{y}</code> of our urls needs to be changed to the literal text string that looks like this: 
  <code>{level}/{col}/{row}</code>
</p>
 
<p>You literally leave those <code>level</code>, <code>col</code>, and <code>row</code> words in there instead of the <code>z,x,y</code></p>
<p>
  <code>AGSWebTiledLayer(urlTemplate: "https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/parceltiles/{level}/{col}/{row}.png?apiKey=&lt;ApiKey&gt;
  </code>
</p>
<br />
<p><img src="/images/tileServer_ARCGis_MyMap.png" alt="ArcGIS Online"></p>
<p><img src="/images/tileServer_ARCGis_AddLayer.png" alt="ArcGIS Desktop"></p>
</div>
<hr>
			<div id="rnoteslink"/>
            <div class="block">
              <h2 id="rnotes">Release Notes</h2>
              <div class="panel-group" id="accordion" role="tablist" aria-multiselectable="true">
    <div class="panel panel-default">
        <!--Heading-->
        <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="heading2025">
            <h4 class="panel-title">
                <a id="beta-five" class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#collapse2025" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapse2025">
                    2025-10
                    <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                </a>
            </h4>
        </div> 
        <div id="collapse2025" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="block2025">
            <div class="panel-body">
                <h4>October, 2025</h4>
                <h5>Changes to Connecticut county identifiers</h5>

                <h5>What’s Changing</h5>
                <p>
                    The State of Connecticut has transitioned from using its eight traditional counties to nine newly designated planning regions as county-equivalents for statistical and geospatial purposes. This change, adopted on June 6, 2022, is now reflected in updated Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) codes.
                </p>
                <p>As part of this statewide update, we plan to implement the new Connecticut FIPS codes in our database effective <b>October 1, 2025</b>. If our timeline changes, we will notify you immediately.</p>
                <h5>Reference Document</h5>
                <p>
                    Please refer to <a href="/attom-assets/docs/New_CT_FIPS_Planning_Regions.xlsx" style="color:#d9534f;">this document</a> outlining the new Connecticut FIPS codes and their mapping to the former county identifiers. This is provided for informational purposes only; no action is required on your part.
                </p>

                <p>
                    We will send a follow up communication as we get closer to the effective date. In the meantime, please reach out if you have any questions.
                </p>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
			  <h3 id="rnotesProp" class="page-subtopics">Property API</h3> 
               
               
              <div id="product-content">
   <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
         <div class="col-lg-12">
            <div class="tab-content" style="padding-top: 0px;padding-bottom: 0px;padding-left: 0px;">
               <!--tab content-->
               <div role="tabpanel" id="release-notes">
                  <!--release-notes content-->
                  <div class="panel-group" id="accordion" role="tablist" aria-multiselectable="true">
                     <div class="panel panel-default">
                        <!--Heading-->
                        <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="heading2023">
                           <h4 class="panel-title">
                              <a id="beta-five"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#collapse2023" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapse2023">
                              Property API V4 - 2023
                              <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                              </a>
                           </h4>
                        </div>
                        <div id="collapse2023" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="block2023">
                            <div class="panel-body">
                              <h4>March, 2023</h4>
                              <h5>New Geocodes</h5>
                              <p>
                                ATTOM is upgrading its geocoding system used to identify geographic areas such as states, counties, and school districts. Property endpoints that previously provided geocodes for a property (geoid) now provide the new gecodes as a new field called geoIdV4. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/579-geocodes" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for more details.
                              </p>
                              <h5>Geocode Search Parameters</h5>
                              <p>
                                All endpoints that support searching via a geocode parameter have been enhanced to support the new geocode - geoidV4. After June 30, 2023 calls to endpoints using the old geocodes (geoid) may not match to all properties. Customers are encourage to migrate applications to support the new geocodes by June 30, 2023.
                              </p>
                              <h5>Property Details With Schools</h5>
                              <p>
                                A new version (V4) of this endpoint has been released. The previous version of the endpoint has been deprecated and customers should migrate to the new version no later than June 30, 2023. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/617-upgrading-to-property-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for details.
                              </p>
                              <h5>Sales Trends</h5>
                              <p>
                                A new version (V4) of this endpoint has been released. The previous version of the endpoint has been deprecated and customers should migrate to the new version no later than June 30, 2023. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/617-upgrading-to-property-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for details.
                              </p>
							  <p>The new version of Sales Trends will support additional geography types:</p>
							  <ul>
								  <li>County (CO)</li>
								  <li>Macro Neighborhood (N1)</li>
								  <li>Neighborhood (N2)</li>
								  <li>Postal City (CI); and</li>
								  <li>Sub Neighborhood (N3)</li>
							  </ul>
							  <p>Two new search parameters have been added for Property Type and Transaction Type allowing for more specific sales trend data to be returned.</p>
							  <p>The allowed values for propertytype are:</p>
							  <ul>
								  <li>ALL</li>
								  <li>CONDO/TOWNHOME</li>
								  <li>COOPERATIVE</li>
								  <li>MANUFACTURED</li>
								  <li>MISCELLANEOUS</li>
								  <li>MULTI (2-4 Units)</li>
								  <li>MULTI 5+</li>
								  <li>SINGLE FAMILY RESIDENCE</li>
								  <li>Vacant Land</li>
							  </ul>
							  <p>The allowed values for transactiontype are:</p>
							  <ul>
								  <li>ALL</li>
								  <li>CONSTRUCTION SALE</li>
								  <li>TRANSFER</li>
								  <li>SUBDIVISION RELATED TRANSFER</li>
							  </ul>
                              <h5>School District</h5>
                              <p>A new version  (V4) of this endpoint has been released. The previous version of the endpoint has been deprecated and customers should migrate to the new version no later than June 30, 2023. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/619-upgrading-to-school-district" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for details.</p>
							  
                              <p>We are migrating to a new source for our school district data. In total, we are expanding the number of fields available from 95 to 229. Almost all the existing field names are changing, the definitions of the data is changing for some fields, and there are some existing fields that will no longer be available.</p>

                              <h5>School Profile</h5>
                              <p>A new version  (V4) of this endpoint has been released. The previous version of the endpoint has been deprecated and customers should migrate to the new version no later than June 30, 2023. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/618-upgrading-to-school-profile-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for details.</p>

                              <p>We are migrating to a new source for our school data. In total, we are expanding the number of fields available from 89 to 201. Almost all the existing field names are changing, the definitions of the data is changing for some fields, and there are some existing fields that will no longer be available.</p>

                              <h5>School Snapshot</h5>
                              <p>A new version  (V4) of this endpoint has been released and is now known as School Search. The previous version of the endpoint has been deprecated and customers should migrate to the new version no later than June 30, 2023. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/618-upgrading-to-school-profile-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for details.</p>

                              <p>For more information about ATTOM API V4 - look <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/612-attom-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a>. For information specific to Property API V4 - look <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/613-upgrading-to-property-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a>.
							  
							  <p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
							</div>
                        </div>
                     </div>

                    <div class="panel panel-default">

                           </h4>
                        </div>
                        <div id="collapseOne" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="block2022">
                            <div class="panel-body">
                              <h4>August, 2022</h4>
                              <p>
                                 <b>New Rental-AVM Endpoint</b>
                              </p>
                              <p>
                                A new Rental AVM endpoint (/valuation/rentalavm) provides estimates of a property’s likely rental value based upon recent rental listings in the area.
                              </p>
                           </div>
                           <div class="panel-body">
                              <h4>February, 2022</h4>
                              <p>
                                 Sales Comparables Endpoint: 
                              </p>
                              <p>
                                 We are aware of an issue with our Sales Comparables endpoint, where some of the recent sales comps are not being returned. Our technology team is actively working on it. Due to the volume of data that needs to be processed as part of the fix, we are expecting to complete it by March 23rd . Thank you for your patience. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a>
                              </p>
                           </div>

                    <div class="panel panel-default">

                        <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingFive">
                           <h4 class="panel-title">
                              <a id="beta-five"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#collapseTwo" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                              Property API V1.0.0 - 2021
                              <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                              </a>
                           </h4>
                        </div>
                        <div id="collapseTwo" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="block2021">
                     	<div class="panel-body">
						<h4>December, 2021</h4>
                            
                              <p>
                                <b>We have added "lastModified" date field to "property transactions" for the following endpoints.</b>
                              </p>
							 
							<br>
							<table class="table table-hover"> 
                                    <thead>
                                       <tr>
                                          <th>Endpoint</th>
                                          <th>JSON Path</th>
                                       </tr>
                                    </thead>
                                    <tbody>
                                       <tr>
                                          <td>sale/detail/</td>
                                          <td>property.sale.vintage.lastModified</td>
                                       </tr>
                                       <tr>
                                          <td>sale/snapshot/ </td>
                                          <td>property.sale.vintage.lastModified</td>
                                       </tr>
									   <tr>
										  <td>saleshistory/detail/</td>
										  <td>property.saleHistory.vintage.lastModified</td>
									   </tr>
									   <tr>
										  <td>saleshistory/snapshot/
										  </td>
										  <td>property.saleHistory.vintage.lastModified</td>										  
									   </tr>
									   <tr>
										  <td>saleshistory/basichistory/
										  </td>
										  <td>property.saleHistory.vintage.lastModified</td>										  
									   </tr>
									   <tr>
										  <td>saleshistory/expandedhistory/ 
										  </td>
										  <td>property.saleHistory.vintage.lastModified</td>										  
									   </tr>
									</tbody>
                                 </table>
                          <h4>September, 2021</h4>
                            <p>
                                <b>New Building Permits Endpoint</b>
							  </p>
                              <p>
                                We have added a new endpoint (property/buildingpermits), for properties in counties that make building permits publicly available, showing details of all building permits that have been applied for by the property owners.
                              </p>
							  <p>
                                <b>New AVM History Endpoint</b>
							  </p>
                              <p>
                                A new AVM endpoint (/avmhistory/detail) providing historical estimates of a property’s value back as far as 2011 for over 94 million properties.
                              </p>
                          <p>
                               <b>New Home Equity Endpoint</b>
							  </p>
                              <p>
                                A new endpoint (valuation/homeequity) that utilizes ATTOM’s proprietary loan model that calculates a home's current value (AVM) and project loan balances for all known mortgages to predict the owner’s current home equity.  
                              </p>
						  <h4>September, 2021</h4>
							<p>
                            <b>API Scheduled Maintenance:</b>
							<br>
							Please be aware that our IT Team will be performing a routine maintenance of our API platform. Refer to the below details:
							<br>
							<br>
							<b>Date & Time:</b> Wednesday, 1st of September from 11 PM to midnight PST
							<br>
							<b>What is being done:</b> We are making a database update to accommodate new datatype for one of the data elements within our API.
							<br>
							<b>What is impacted:</b> Following endpoints will be unavailable during this period:
							<br>
							<br>
							Host names affected:
							<ul>
								   <li>https://api.attomdata.com/</li>
								   <li>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/</li>
							</ul>
							<br>
							<br>
							Endpoints:
							<ul>
								   <li>/property/v2/AVMReport/</li>
								   <li>/property/v2/BasicHistory/</li>
								   <li>/property/v2/BasicProfile/</li>
								   <li>/property/v2/ExpandedHistory/</li>
								   <li>/property/v2/ExpandedProfile/</li>
								   <li>/property/v2/PropertySearch/</li>
								   <li>/property/v2/QuantumAVMReport/</li>
								   <li>/property/v2/SalesComparables/</li>
								   <li>/property/v3/preforeclosuredetails</li>
							</ul>
							<br>
							<br>
							<b>What is not impacted: </b> Endpoints starting with the below base address are NOT affected by this change:

							<p>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/propertyapi/v1.0.0/
							<ul>
								   <li>/property/*</li>
								   <li>/allevents/*</li>
								   <li>/assessment/*</li>
								   <li>/avm/*</li>
								   <li>/avm/*</li>
								   <li>/attomavm/*</li>
								   <li>/sale/*</li>
								   <li>/salehistory/*</li>
								   <li>/enumeration/*</li>
								   <li>/avm/*</li>
							</ul>

							<p>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/transportationnoise/
							<p>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/areaapi/
							<p>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/communityapi/
							<p>https://api.gateway.attomdata.com/poisearch/
							<br>
							<br>
							<p>If you have any questions, please contact us via <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a>.
                          <h4>July, 2021</h4>
							  <p>
                                As part of this release, we added a new endpoint - <b>Transportation Noise</b> (/transportationnoise)<b>:</b>
							  </p>
                              <ul>
                                <li>
                                Returns a location’s noise environment. Includes noise ratings for roads and highways, airports, railroads, railroad crossings and hospital/fire vehicle stations.
                                </li>
							    <li>
								Location can be given as one-line address, 2-line address or latitude+longitude combination.
                                </li>
                              </ul>
                              <h4>May, 2021</h4>
							  <p>
							  We have made updates to our school API calls!
							  </p>
                              <p>
                                 A new parameter GEOID has been added to the following endpoints. So these endpoints can now be queried by both ID (Institution ID) and GEOID parameters.
                              </p>
                              <ul>
                                <li>
                                /school/districtdetail
                                </li>
							    <li>
								/school/detail
                                </li>
                              </ul>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                     <!--End-->
                  <!--accordion end panel-->
               </div>

			  <h3 id="rnotesArea" class="page-subtopics">Area API</h3> 
              
              <div id="product-content">
        <div class="container">
           <div class="row">
            <div class="col-lg-12">
                <div class="tab-content" style="padding-top: 0px;padding-bottom: 0px;padding-left: 0px;"><!--tab content-->
                                 
                    <div role="tabpanel" id="release-notes"> 
                    <!--release-notes content-->
                         <div class="panel-group" id="accordion" role="tablist" aria-multiselectable="true"><!--Accordion panel-->
                           <div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading Four-->
                                <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingArea2023">
                                    <h4 class="panel-title">
                                        <a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#AreaCollapse2023" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                                        Area API V4 - 2023
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
                            <div id="AreaCollapse2023" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingArea2023">
                                <div class="panel-body">
                                    <h4>March 2023</h4>
									<h5>New Geocodes</h5>
									<p>ATTOM is upgrading its geocoding system used to identify geographic areas such as states, counties, and school districts. The Area API provides information about the geographies defined by these geocodes. The existing endpoints have been modified to support the new geocodes (geoIdV4) as a parameter as well as providing the new geocodes as part of the output for the relevant endpoints.  See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/579-geocodes" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for more details.</p>

									<h5>New Version</h5>
									<p>We are deprecating the existing V2 endpoints and moving to new V4 versions of each endpoint. The existing endpoints will continue to work, but ATTOM encourages all customers to use the new versions when creating new applications using this API. It is recommended, but not required, that customers upgrade existing applications to use the latest version of the Area API endpoints.</p>

									<h5>New Boundary Endpoint</h5>
									<p>A new boundary endpoint is now available, returning a definition of the boundary around various geographies. The definitions can be provided in either WKT or GeoJSON formats.</p>

									<p>The boundary endpoint is included as part of Premium Property packages.</p>

									<h5>New Location Lookup Endpoint</h5>
									<p>To assist with migration to ATTOM API V4, we are providing a new endpoint that searches geographies of a particular type that match specific text. The endpoint returns details about each matching geography, including the gecode used to uniquely identify it.</p>

									<p>There is no charge to use this endpoint.</p>

									<h5>New Geo ID Legacy Lookup</h5>
									<p>To assist with migration to ATTOM API V4, we are providing a new endpoint that converts the original geocodes (geoid) to the new version (geoIdV4).</p>

									<p>There is no charge to use this endpoint.</p>

									<p>For more information about ATTOM API V4 - look <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/612-attom-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a>. For information specific to Area API V4 - look <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/620-upgrading-area-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a>.</p>
									<p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
								</div>
							</div>	
						</div><!--End--> 
							<div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading Three-->
                                <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingTwo">
                                    <h4 class="panel-title">
                                        <a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#AreaCollapseSix" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                                        Area API V2.0.0 - 2020
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
								<div id="AreaCollapseSix" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingTwo">
									<div class="panel-body">
										<h4>October, 2020 </h4>
										<p>We have made updates to our Area API.</p>
										<p>The Area API will not include Metro (MT) data. As a replacement, you can use CBSA (CB).</p>
										<p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
									</div>
								</div>	
                            </div><!--End-->
							<div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading Three-->
                                <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingTwo">
                                    <h4 class="panel-title">
                                        <a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#AreaCollapseFive" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                                        Area API V2.0.0 - 2018
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
								<div id="AreaCollapseFive" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingTwo">
									<div class="panel-body">
										<h4>April, 2018 </h4>
										<p>We have made updates to our Area API!</p>
										<p>The /hierarchy/lookup API call has been updated to make searching easier and more efficient. </p>
										<p>The API call now accepts latitude and longitude as inputs, as opposed to only points from a WKT string, which became difficult because the latitude and longitude order was switched.</p>
									  <p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
									</div>
								</div>	
                            </div><!--End-->
                    </div><!--accordion end panel-->             
                    <!--end release-notes content-->
                    </div>
                </div><!--end TabContent-->

              <h3 id="rnotesPoi" class="page-subtopics">Points of Interest API</h3>
              
              <div id="product-content">
<div class="container">
<div class="row">
<div class="col-lg-12">
<div class="tab-content" style="padding-top: 0px;padding-bottom: 0px;padding-left: 0px;"><!--tab content-->

<div role="tabpanel" id="release-notes"> <!--release-notes content-->
     <div class="panel-group" id="accordion" role="tablist" aria-multiselectable="true"><!--Accordion panel-->
	 
                        <div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading Two-->
                                <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingTwo">
                                    <h4 class="panel-title">
                                        <a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#POICollapseThree" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                                        <strong>POI API V4</strong> - 2023
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
                            <div id="POICollapseThree" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingTwo">
                                <div class="panel-body">
                                  <h4>March 2023</h4>

                                  <h5>New Geocodes</h5>
                                  <p>ATTOM is upgrading its geocoding system used to identify geographic areas such as states, counties, and school districts. The Community API uses these geocodes to define the community statistics to be returned. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/579-geocodes" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for more details.</p>

                                  <h5>POI Search</h5>
                                  <p>A new version (V4) of the POI endpoints has been released. The previous versions of each endpoint have been deprecated and customers should migrate to the new version no later than June 30, 2023. See here for details.</p>
                                  <p>We are migrating to a new source of our POI data. In total, we are expanding the number of fields available from 18 to 59.</p>

                                  <h5>CategoryLookup</h5>
                                  <p>The Category Lookup and LOB Lookup endpoints have been merged into a single endpoint.</p>
                                  <p>For more information about ATTOM API V4 - look <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/612-attom-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a>.</p>
								  <p></p>
								  <p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
                              </div>
                            </div>
                        </div><!--End-->
                        <div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading Two-->
                                <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingTwo">
                                    <h4 class="panel-title">
                                        <a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#POICollapseTwo" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                                        <strong>POI API V2.0.0</strong> - April 2018
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
                            <div id="POICollapseTwo" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingTwo">
                                <div class="panel-body">
                                  <h4>What's new?</h4>
                                  <p>We have made updates to our POI API!</p>
								  <p>The /poi/point and /poi/street+address API calls have both been updated to make searching easier and more efficient.
								  </p>
                                  <p>The /poi/point API call now accepts latitude and longitude as inputs, as opposed to only points from a WKT string, which became difficult because the latitude and longitude order was switched.
                                  </p> 
                                  <p>The /poi/street+address call now accepts our standard address1 and address2 fields for searching so you no longer need to add a semi colon in the middle of your address.
                                  </p>
								  <p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
                              </div>
                            </div>
                        </div><!--End-->
                            <div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading Two-->
                                <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingTwo">
                                    <h4 class="panel-title">
                                        <a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#POICollapseOne" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                                        <strong>POI API V2.0.0</strong> - July 2017
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
                            <div id="POICollapseOne" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingTwo">
                                <div class="panel-body">
                                  <h4>What's new?</h4>
                                  <p>We have added the functionality to allow for filtering by Business Category in the POI API! </p>
								  <p>This filter is available within the /poi/point call and will allow you to filter results by one-to-many Business Categories, such as eating-drinking, shopping, etc… for all 14 business categories. 
								  </p>
								  <p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
								</div><!--End-->
							</div>  
						</div><!--accordion end panel-->  
                </div><!--end TabContent-->
               </div>
           </div>
        </div> <!--end row-->

			  <h3 id="rnotesCom" class="page-subtopics">Community API</h3>
              
                  <div id="product-content">
        <div class="container">
           <div class="row">
            <div class="col-lg-12">
                <div class="tab-content" style="padding-top: 0px;padding-bottom: 0px;padding-left: 0px;">
				<!--tab content-->
                    <div role="tabpanel" id="release-notes"> 
                    <!--release-notes content-->
                        <div class="panel-group" id="accordion" role="tablist" aria-multiselectable="true">
						<!--Accordion panel-->
							<div class="panel panel-default">
							<!--Heading Three-->
                                <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingComm2023">
                                    <h4 class="panel-title">
                                    <a id="beta-three  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#ComCollapse2023" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseThree">
                                        Community API V4 - 2023
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
                            <div id="ComCollapse2023" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingComm2023">
                                <div class="panel-body">
									<h4>March 2023</h4>
									
									<h5>New Geocodes</h5>
									<p>ATTOM is upgrading its geocoding system used to identify geographic areas such as states, counties, and school districts. The Community API uses these geocodes to define the community statistics to be returned. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/579-geocodes" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for more details.</p>
									
									<h5>Community</h5>
									<p>A new version (v4) of this endpoint has been released. The previous version of the endpoint has been deprecated and customers should migrate to the new version no later than June 30, 2023. See <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/582-upgrading-community-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a> for details.</p>
									<p>We are migrating to a new source for our community data. In total, we are expanding the number of fields available from 378 to 628. Almost all the existing field names are changing, the definitions of the data is changing for some fields, and there are some existing fields that will no longer be available.</p>
									
									<h5>V1 Endpoints Deprecated</h5>
									<p>The original V1 endpoints will not be supported after June 30, 2023. These endpoints used tokens to authenticate. If you are one of the small number of customers still making calls to these endpoints, a representative from ATTOM should contact you to issue an API Key that is now being used for all ATTOM API endpoints.</p>
									<p>For more information about ATTOM API V4 - look <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/612-attom-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a>. For information specific to Community API V4 - look <a href="https://cloud-help.attomdata.com/article/582-upgrading-community-api-v4" style="color:#d9534f;">here</a>.</p>
								</div>
								<!--End-->
							</div>  
						</div>
						<!--accordion end panel-->
                          
                          
                        <div class="panel panel-default">
						<!--Heading Two-->
                            <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingTwo">
                                <h4 class="panel-title">
                                        <a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#ComCollapseTwo" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                                        <strong>Community API V2.0.0</strong> - July 2019
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
                            <div id="ComCollapseTwo" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingTwo">
                                <div class="panel-body">
                                  <h4>Breaking Change</h4>
                                  <p>ATTOM Data Solutions is no longer licensed to provide Sales Tax Rate (<b>salesTaxRate</b>) or Sales Tax Type (<b>salesTaxType</b>) within our Community data, so we are <b>removing</b> these two fields from the endpoint /communityapi/v2.0.0/area/full. </p>
								  <p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
								</div>
								<!--End-->
							</div>  
						</div>
						<!--accordion end panel-->
                        <div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading One-->
                            <div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingOne">
                                <h4 class="panel-title">
                                <a id="beta-one"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#ComCollapseOne" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseOne">
                                        <strong>Community API V2.0.0</strong> - April 2016
                                         <i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                                        </a>
                                    </h4>
                                </div>
                            <div id="ComCollapseOne" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingOne">
                                <div class="panel-body">
                                  <h4>What's new in 2.0</h4>
                                  <p>Notable changes to the API include the change to the base URL structure and updated security.</p><br/><br/>
                                  <p><strong>URL Structure</strong></p><br/>
                                  <p>V1 URL Structure</p>
                                  <p><pre><code>http://api.ist_prod.obiwebservices.com/Community/Area/Full/?&AreaId=NH0031106&AccessToken= </code></pre></p><br/>
                                  <p>V2 URL Structure</p>
                                  <p><pre><code>https://search.onboard-apis.com/communityapi/v2.0.0/area/full?AreaId=CO44003</code></pre></p><br/>         
                                  <p><strong>Updated Security</strong></p><br/>
                                  <p>Users are no longer required to include their "AccessToken" in the URL request. Instead you'll need to include your APIKey in the request header.</p><br/>
                              
                                  <p><strong>Other Changes</strong></p><br/>
                                  <p>V1 required users to include either mime=xml or mime=json in their URL string to indicate the type of response requested. This is still supported in V2. However, a user can also choose to set "Accept" to either application/json or application/xml in the header to receive the same result.</p><br/>
								  <p>Test drive the new version of API today! You can try out the calls in the Interactive Docs or sign up for a <strong>FREE</strong> trial account.</p>                              
                                  <br/>
                                  <p>If you have any questions, please contact us! Email our Team: <a href="mailto:datacustomercare@attomdata.com" class="link">datacustomercare@attomdata.com</a></p>
                                  
                            </div><!--End-->

                    </div><!--accordion end panel-->                      
  
                    <!--end release-notes content-->
                    </div>
       
                </div><!--end TabContent-->
            </div>
             </div>
           </div>
        </div> <!--end row-->
    </div><!--end container-fluid-->
</div><!--end product-content-->
		        

              <h3 id="rnotesTiles" class="page-subtopics">Parcel Tiles API</h3> 
                             
              <div id="product-content">
<div class="container">
<div class="row">
<div class="col-lg-12">
<div class="tab-content" style="padding-top: 0px;padding-bottom: 0px;padding-left: 0px;"><!--tab content-->

	<div role="tabpanel" id="release-notes"> <!--release-notes content-->
		<div class="panel-group" id="accordion" role="tablist" aria-multiselectable="true"><!--Accordion panel-->
			<div class="panel panel-default"> <!--Heading Two-->
				<div class="panel-heading" role="tab" id="headingTwo">
					<h4 class="panel-title">
                 		<a id="beta-two"  class="collapsed" role="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#TilesCollapseThree" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
                 			<strong>Parcel Tiles API V1.0.0</strong> - January 2023
                          	<i class="fa fa-chevron-down"></i>
                       	</a>
             		</h4>
         		</div>
                            
             	<div id="TilesCollapseThree" class="panel-collapse collapse" role="tabpanel" aria-labelledby="headingTwo">
               		<div class="panel-body">
                 		<h4>January, 2023</h4>
                      <p>ATTOM is proud to announce the addition of <a href="#tileOverview" onclick="ifChrome('tileOverview');" style="color: #337ab7;">Parcel Tiles API</a> to our suite.</p>
                      	<p>This API serves parcel tiles in raster (PNG) format, which can be used with web mapping tools such as Mapbox GL and Leaflet.</p>
                  	</div>
          		</div>
        	</div><!--End-->

		</div><!--accordion end panel-->                      
       	<!--end release-notes content-->
 	</div>
  </div><!--end TabContent-->
  </div>
  </div>
  </div> <!--end row-->
  </div><!--end container-fluid-->
  </div><!--end product-content-->
		        
              
            </div>

<br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/>

   
      <input type="hidden" id="user_app_key" value="ac9baaaaccb6fa576912621cc1d7ab33" />


<script>
  /*New Swagger Start*/
    function swaggerSectionHtml(domId) {
    var html = '<div class="swagger-section"><div id="message-bar" class="swagger-ui-wrap">&nbsp;</div><div id="' + domId + '" class="swagger-ui-wrap"></div></div>'
    return html;
  }
  
  function getSwaggerSpecUrl(specSystemName) {
    // check parent location, if it's iframe
    var loc = window.location.href == 'about:srcdoc' ? window.parent.location : window.location;
    var url = loc.protocol+'//'+loc.hostname+(loc.port ? ':'+loc.port : '');
    url = url + "/swagger/spec/" + specSystemName + ".json";
    return url;
  }
  
  function loadSwagger(specSystemName, domId) {
    
    // create DOM element
    $("#swagger-ui-containers").append(swaggerSectionHtml(domId));
    
    var swaggerObjName = 'swaggerUi' + specSystemName;
    var swaggerObj = new SwaggerUi({
      url: getSwaggerSpecUrl(specSystemName),
      dom_id: domId,
      supportedSubmitMethods: ['get', 'post', 'put', 'delete', 'patch'],
      apisSorter: 'alpha',
      onComplete: function(swaggerApi, swaggerUi) {
       $(document.getElementById(swaggerUi.dom_id)).find('pre code').each(function(i, e) {hljs.highlightBlock(e)})
      },
      docExpansion: 'list',
      transport: function (httpClient, obj) { ApiDocsProxy.execute(httpClient, obj) }
    });
    window[swaggerObjName] = swaggerObj;
    window[swaggerObjName].options['validatorUrl'] = null;
    window[swaggerObjName].load();
  }

  function loadMultipleSpecs(){

    // Remove the default swagger-section created in the 'shared/swagger_ui' partial
    $("#swagger-ui-container").parent().remove();
    
    var specsStr = 'propertyapi_propertv1, propertyapi_transactionv4, dlpv2_preforeclosures, propertyapi_transactionv1, propertyapi-valuationv1, dlpv2_sales_comparables, propertyapi_propertydetailv4, propertyapi_v4,transportationnoise, propertyapi_enumerations';
    var specs = specsStr.split(',');
    specs = specs.filter(Boolean); // remove empty elements
    
    for (var i=0; i < specs.length; i++) {
      var specSystemName = $.trim(specs[i]);
      if (specSystemName != '') {
        var domId = "swagger-ui-container-" + specSystemName;
        loadSwagger(specSystemName, domId);
      }
    }
  }
 
  /*START AREA API*/
    function loadSwaggerAreaAPI(specSystemName, domId) {
    
    // create DOM element
    $("#swagger-ui-container-area-api").append(swaggerSectionHtml(domId));
    
    var swaggerObjName = 'swaggerUi' + specSystemName;
    var swaggerObj = new SwaggerUi({
      url: getSwaggerSpecUrl(specSystemName),
      dom_id: domId,
      supportedSubmitMethods: ['get', 'post', 'put', 'delete', 'patch'],
      apisSorter: 'alpha',
      onComplete: function(swaggerApi, swaggerUi) {
       $(document.getElementById(swaggerUi.dom_id)).find('pre code').each(function(i, e) {hljs.highlightBlock(e)})
      },
      docExpansion: 'list',
      transport: function (httpClient, obj) { ApiDocsProxy.execute(httpClient, obj) }
    });
    window[swaggerObjName] = swaggerObj;
    window[swaggerObjName].options['validatorUrl'] = null;
    window[swaggerObjName].load();
  }

  function loadMultipleSpecsAreaAPI(){

    // Remove the default swagger-section created in the 'shared/swagger_ui' partial
    $("#swagger-ui-container").parent().remove();
    
    var specsStr = 'AreaAPI';
    var specs = specsStr.split(',');
    specs = specs.filter(Boolean); // remove empty elements
    
    for (var i=0; i < specs.length; i++) {
      var specSystemName = $.trim(specs[i]);
      if (specSystemName != '') {
        var domId = "swagger-ui-container-" + specSystemName;
        loadSwaggerAreaAPI(specSystemName, domId);
      }
    }
  }
  /*END AREA API*/

  /*START POI API*/
    function loadSwaggerPOIAPI(specSystemName, domId) {
    
    // create DOM element
    $("#swagger-ui-container-poi-api").append(swaggerSectionHtml(domId));
    
    var swaggerObjName = 'swaggerUi' + specSystemName;
    var swaggerObj = new SwaggerUi({
      url: getSwaggerSpecUrl(specSystemName),
      dom_id: domId,
      supportedSubmitMethods: ['get', 'post', 'put', 'delete', 'patch'],
      apisSorter: 'alpha',
      onComplete: function(swaggerApi, swaggerUi) {
       $(document.getElementById(swaggerUi.dom_id)).find('pre code').each(function(i, e) {hljs.highlightBlock(e)})
      },
      docExpansion: 'list',
      transport: function (httpClient, obj) { ApiDocsProxy.execute(httpClient, obj) }
    });
    window[swaggerObjName] = swaggerObj;
    window[swaggerObjName].options['validatorUrl'] = null;
    window[swaggerObjName].load();
  }

  function loadMultipleSpecsPOIAPI(){

    // Remove the default swagger-section created in the 'shared/swagger_ui' partial
    $("#swagger-ui-container").parent().remove();
    
    var specsStr = 'POIAPIV4';
    var specs = specsStr.split(',');
    specs = specs.filter(Boolean); // remove empty elements
    
    for (var i=0; i < specs.length; i++) {
      var specSystemName = $.trim(specs[i]);
      if (specSystemName != '') {
        var domId = "swagger-ui-container-" + specSystemName;
        loadSwaggerPOIAPI(specSystemName, domId);
      }
    }
  }
  /*END POI API*/    
  
  /*START Community v4 API*/
   function loadSwaggerCommunityv4API(specSystemName, domId) {
    
    // create DOM element
    $("#swagger-ui-container-communityv4-api").append(swaggerSectionHtml(domId));
    
    var swaggerObjName = 'swaggerUi' + specSystemName;
    var swaggerObj = new SwaggerUi({
      url: getSwaggerSpecUrl(specSystemName),
      dom_id: domId,
      supportedSubmitMethods: ['get', 'post', 'put', 'delete', 'patch'],
      apisSorter: 'alpha',
      onComplete: function(swaggerApi, swaggerUi) {
       $(document.getElementById(swaggerUi.dom_id)).find('pre code').each(function(i, e) {hljs.highlightBlock(e)})
      },
      docExpansion: 'list',
      transport: function (httpClient, obj) { ApiDocsProxy.execute(httpClient, obj) }
    });
    window[swaggerObjName] = swaggerObj;
    window[swaggerObjName].options['validatorUrl'] = null;
    window[swaggerObjName].load();
  }

  function loadMultipleSpecsCommunityv4API(){

    // Remove the default swagger-section created in the 'shared/swagger_ui' partial
    $("#swagger-ui-container").parent().remove();
    
    var specsStr = 'COMMUNITYV4_API';
    var specs = specsStr.split(',');
    specs = specs.filter(Boolean); // remove empty elements
    
    for (var i=0; i < specs.length; i++) {
      var specSystemName = $.trim(specs[i]);
      if (specSystemName != '') {
        var domId = "swagger-ui-container-" + specSystemName;
        loadSwaggerCommunityv4API(specSystemName, domId);
      }
    }
  }
  /*END Community v4 API*/
  
  $(function () {
     loadMultipleSpecs();
     loadMultipleSpecsAreaAPI();
     
     loadMultipleSpecsPOIAPI();
     loadMultipleSpecsCommunityv4API();
  }); 
  /*New Swagger End*/
</script>

        </div> <!-- /container -->
 
    </div>
</div>
  <!-- END SIDE MENU -->
